Title: Unidentified men make attempt to steal cash from post office
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: A group of unidentified men on late Thursday night made an abortive attempt to enter the post office in South Malaqa area of the city with an intention to loot money.

Station house officer (Kotwali) said, “The incident took place late on Thursday night when a group of men managed to break the outer lock of the post office gate but were not able gain entry inside. Cash worth Rs 85,000 was kept inside the post office.

The incident came to light when a post office employee on Friday morning came to open its gate only to find the outer lock broken. He immediately informed Kotwali police station.

On being alerted, a team of Kotwali police along with fingerprint experts rushed to the spot and carried out investigations.

“We are making efforts to identify those involved in the incident through CCTV footage. A team has also been assigned to crack the case,” said an inspector.

Title: Detective department cop held for robbery in West Bengal's Chitpore
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: Almost seven months after two cops were arrested for masterminding a robbery in the Muchipara area, a detective department constable — Pranoy Roy of the dog squad — was arrested on Thursday for masterminding a similar gold heist in Chitpore . The incident took place in November last year.

Police said Roy had asked four of his associates — Shantanu Karar, Chandan Raut and Monojit Mondal from Howrah and Sk Akram from East Burdwan — to commit the November heist, posing as income tax officers. “We arrested Roy’s associates three days ago. We wanted to know why they chose Kolkata and learnt about the role of Roy. He was very much present near the crime spot,” said DC (North) Joyeeta Bose.

According to police, the November 11 incident took place when Chitpore jewellery shop employee Sk Hasibul Ali was returning to his shop with around 300 gm gold worth Rs 12 lakh. “It was evening and the five men identified themselves as I-T officials. They took away the gold and his mobile. Ali reported the matter to Chitpore police,” said an officer from north division. Sources said Roy might be part of an inter-state gang. “He will face a departmental inquiry too,” said an officer.

Cops said the accused were caught after the gang tried to use the same modus operandi to rob another jeweller near the same area on January 26. The cops said this time they had targeted 400 gm of gold worth Rs 16 lakh. “The CCTV footage matched and we managed to nab the accused,” an officer said.

Bose said the accused is now in police custody. Officers at Lalbazar said this was the third instance in a year that a cop from Kolkata and its surrounding commissionarates have been arrested for committing a serious crime.

Title: Mangaluru: VHP, Bajrang Dal to help acid attack victim financially
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

MANGALURU: The Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP), Bajarang Dal and Durga Vahini will offer help to acid attack victim Swapna.

Vidyananda Saraswati, seer of Mathashree Shivajyana Mayi, Om Shri Mutt, said on Friday, “We are planning to help acid attack victims financially, and will donate Rs 1 lakh to them. Apart from it, we will also make plans to collect funds for medical expenses and rehabilitation of the family,” he said, adding that the VHP, Bajrang Dal and Durga Vahini condemn such acid attacks.

Swapna, in her complaint to superintendent of police B M Laxmi Prasad on January 27 had stated that her brother-in-law Jayanand was exhibiting lecherous behaviour whenever he visited her house on some or the other pretext. She has also stated that she had complained about this to the women’s police station at Puttur.

Vidyananda Saraswati alleged that after the death of Swapna’s husband, accused Jayanand was trying to exploit the victim sexually. However, she was facing all of it bravely. “Swapna had to keep silent since she had no support from anyone. On the day of the attack, Jayanand tried to kill her by using a sickle, but she managed to escape and locked herself inside the house. When she went inside, he opened a bottle of acid used for making rubber sheets, and threw it inside the house. The acid fell on Swapna and also her daughter, who has sustained minor injuries,” he explained. Swapna has received burns on her face and chest and lost an eye, while her daughter has sustained minor injuries on her legs and hands.

Surekha Raj, district vice-secretary of VHP, demanded that the case be tried in a fast-track court, and the government must sanction compensation to Swapna. After her husband Ravi’s death two years ago, she was taking care of her family.

Title: Mining firms refuse to pay water bills of Shirgao locals
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Villagers of Shirgao claim that water bills of 371 houses, amounting to Rs 20 lakh, have remained unpaid since... Read More

BICHOLIM: The three mining firms operating in Shirgao have refused to pay pending water bills of the villagers.

A meeting was held on Friday between villagers and officials of the mining companies at the office of Bicholim deputy collector. Locals claimed that water bills of 371 houses, amounting to Rs 20 lakh, have been pending since March 2018.

The officials, however, said that since their respective companies were already contributing to the district mineral fund, it would not be possible for them to pay off the water bills of the villagers too. This refusal resulted in a tense situation.

Later on Friday evening, the villagers convened a meeting during which they decided to continue their agitation until the water bills are paid. “We will continue to agitate until we get justice,” Shirgao sarpanch Sadanand Gaonkar, said.

Title: China-returned student doesn’t show symptoms
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

However, SSG Hospital doctors advised him home quarantine

Vadodara: A youth from Panchmahal district who had returned from China along with nine others on Wednesday was rushed to the SSG Hospital (SSGH) on Friday morning after he fell ill.

However, after examination the youth was allowed to return home and advised isolation at home.

The youth who is studying medicine was Jiujiang in China returned home in wake of the novel coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan city of China. Medical examination while he was leaving China and even by health teams in Panchmahal, however, did not reveal any ailments so far.

The youth had fever since Thursday night and looking into the symptoms, health teams were called to examine him. He was taken to the Godhra Civil Hospital which referred him to SSGH at Vadodara.

Sources said that the youth did not show any symptoms that relate to the novel coronavirus infection. He was kept at the SSGH for examination the entire day and was later allowed to go home, but advised home quarantine.

“He has been given necessary medicines and advised precautions by the doctors. There is no reason to worry as of now,” said a relative of the youth. The youth, however, will remain under observation of local health teams in Panchmahal.

Title: Govt begins 5 centres of Shiv Bhojan in city
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Nagpur: The state government has launched five centres of Shiv Bhojan to provide lunch at Rs10 per plate for needy persons. Three of five centres have been opened near government-run hospitals to facilitate delicious lunch at nominal rate for families of patients.

District food and civil supplies officer Bhaskar Tayade told TOI that the centres have been opened at Daga Hospital, Matru Sewa Sangh’s maternity home in Central Nagpur, RST Cancer Hospital at Tukadoji Putla square, MSRTC Bus stand at Ganeshpeth and APMC Market at Kalamna.

“Four were opened on January 26 and the remaining one on January 30. Lunch will be provided between 12 noon and 2pm at the rate of Rs10 per plate finalized by the government. Self-help-group and agencies running the centres will recover Rs10 from the beneficiary. The government will give Rs40 per plate from its side as total expenditure on one plate is Rs50,” he said.

The district food and civil supplies department under the collector’s office is the nodal agency for the scheme.

As per the government’s directive, the SHG/agency running the centre will have to provide two chapatis, a veg curry, dal and rice. The menu will change daily and will be decided by the government. The centre will run on an app developed by the government. The SHG/agency will get instructions on the menu daily on the app.

The government has set up five centres on a pilot basis for three months. Considering the experience of pilot project, the government is likely to increase the timings of the centres and also number of centres in the city.

Shiv Sena MP from Ramtek Krupal Tumane inaugurated the centre at Matru Sewa Sangh’s hospital. He appreciated the scheme launched by CM Uddhav Thackeray. He also gave some suggestions for further improvement at the centre.

NCP city president Anil Ahirkar dedicated the centre to the public at Daga Hospital. He along with a slew of guests lauded the noble gesture of the government.

Yuva Zep Pratishtan headed by mayor Sandip Joshi had launched Deendayal Lunch Box scheme at Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH) and two more locations where families of patients also get lunch at Rs10 since 2017.

Title: Woman excise inspector run over by bus in Piplani
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

New Doc 2020-01-31 18.16.54

Bhopal: In yet another fatal accident reported at Ratnagiri trisection in Piplani, a speeding bus hit a 48-year-old woman while she was going to office on her scooter on Friday morning. The victim fell on the road and her head was crushed under the wheels of the bus. Though she was wearing a helmet, she sustained critical injuries.

Locals called an ambulance and rushed the victim to JP Hospital where doctors declared her brought dead. Piplani police registered a case against the errant bus driver and seized the bus.

Investigation officer ASI Komal Singh said that the deceased, Shiney Thomas, wife of Joseph Thomas, a resident of 99-Vrindawan Nagar in Ayodhya Nagar, was posted as inspector at Central Excise department at GST Bhawan. Her husband is posted in the agriculture department. ASI Singh said that around 10 am, the deceased was going to her office in Arera Hills when the accident occurred. When she reached Ratnagiri Trisection and was taking the right turn towards Piplani petrol pump on Raisen Road, a speeding bus coming from Anand Nagar side and hit her scooter from the rear.

Shiney lost the scooter’s control and fell. The speeding bus driver couldn’t stop the vehicle and ran over Shiney. ASI Singh said that the locals rushed Shiney to JP hospital where she was declared brought dead. Piplani police seized the bus and registered a case against the errant bus driver. ASI Singh said that the bus was coming from a marriage party after dropping its occupants and was empty. Further investigations were on in case.

Title: 67-year-old commits suicide by jumping off highrise in Manjalpur
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Vadodara: A 67-year-old man committed suicide by jumping off seventh floor of a residential complex in Manjalpur area of the city on Friday morning. Ajay Dave jumped off balcony of the building and was spotted lying in a pool of blood by a local. Police said he died on the spot.

Police said Dave, a resident of Vithhalbaug Society, told his family that he was going for morning walk. When he didn’t return for a long time, they began looking for him. Dave had meanwhile committed suicide but residents of Satva Apartments didn’t recognize him as he wasn’t a resident of that apartment.

The police later found out his identity and informed his family. “He was suffering from some mental disease over last few months and used to be in depression. It seems he took the extreme step due to the same reason,” said Manjalpur police inspector B G Chetariya. He said they will try to ascertain if there are any other reasons behind the suicide. A neighbour said he wasn’t aware of Dave’s illness and was surprised that he chose to end his life.

Title: Early bird, Kerala may not be a major beneficiary
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The benefits that may trickle down to Kerala from Bharat Net programme for which the Union finance minister has set apart Rs 6,000 crore in the latest budget may be insignificant if not nil, at least during the current fiscal.

The Rs 6,000 allocation the Union finance minister announced in her budget proposes to ensure internet connectivity to 1 lakh more gram panchayaths in the country. Bharat Net, an ongoing programme, has till date not benefitted Kerala as the state has already established internet connectivity when the programme was rolled out in 2017.

The state government, however, is in constant talks with the Centre with the demand that the state should not be denied the central assistance for establishing broadband internet connectivity because it already has achieved the objective. “We are in talks with the Centre and we have been promised that Kerala would be considered for the allocation once the basic objective of establishing connectivity in panchayats across the country is established. We made the request for assistance to our KFON project through which we plan to establish high speed internet connectivity all across the state at an affordable pricing. We don’t know how much assistance we may get and when we would be getting the same,” IT secretary M Sivasankar said.

Bharat Broadband Network (BBNL), touted as the largest rural broadband project under the Ministry of IT and Telecommunications, is the agency assigned for establishing the broadband network in rural areas. In Kerala, BBNL established the broadband connectivity in gram panchayat level with the assistance of BSNL. However, BBNL later chose a private partner over BSNL for the operation and maintenance of its broadband service.

Title: Snatching at Survey Park
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: Three snatchers on two bikes attacked a 29-year-old youth, a resident of Prince Gholam Mohammad Shah Road in Jadavpur , in the Naskarpara area under Survey Park police station and fled with his gold rings and cash on Thursday evening. The incident was reported around 5.45pm.

The victim has been identified as Sayan Das Burman. The incident, that too in the evening, has led locals to demand better police patrolling in the area. Police said they were checking CCTV footage of the area for concrete leads. The police are yet to make any arrest. “We are trying to locate the bikes used in the crime,” said police.

Title: Professional college admission, entrance commission issues notification
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Applications for admission to professional colleges in the state, including medical colleges, can be submitted to the office of state entrance commissioner from February 1 to 25. Commissioner for entrance examinations here on Friday notified the procedures for admission to the courses in 2020.

Applications can be submitted online on the entrance commissioner’s website www.cee.kerala.gov.in. Along with other details, applications are supposed to upload a recent passport size photograph and other documents such as nativity certificate, birth certificate and specimen signature. Other documents required for establishing any other eligibility criteria can be uploaded till 5 pm on February 29. Candidates are not supposed to send hardcopy of their application and other supporting documents via post to the commissioner's office.

Those who have submitted applications for NEET 2020 should compulsorily submit applications to the state entrance commissioner for admission to medical and allied professional colleges in the state. Though admission to these courses are made from the NEET list, it's the state entrance commissioner who completes the admission procedures to medical and allied courses in the state. For clarifications and queries, candidates can reach out to the office of entrance commissioner over the telephone number 0471-2525300 from 8 am to 8 pm.

``Candidates seeking admission to any of the Medical & Allied courses should compulsorily appear for and qualify in the National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test-Under Graduate (NEET UG) 2020 conducted by the National Testing Agency(NTA). The CEE will conduct Entrance Examination for admission to Engineering/Pharmacy Courses only. Candidates seeking admission to B.Pharm course shall have to appear for and qualify in Paper-I (Physics & Chemistry) of the Engineering Entrance Examination. Candidates seeking admission to B.Arch. course should compulsorily appear for and qualify in the National Aptitude Test in Architecture (NATA) conducted by the Council of Architecture (COA) on or before 01.06.2020'', the notification said.

The state entrance test for admission to engineering and B.Pharm courses are scheduled to be held on April 20 and 21 .

ends..

Title: BU to polish its image through a documentary
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

up

Bhopal: In an attempt at image makeover, Barkatullah University has decided to make a documentary about the facilities and history of the varsity. Madhyam will make the documentary, which is likely to be released by March.

For the past few years, the university has witnessed several controversies. According to officials, as the university is desperate to upgrade its grade in NAAC, there was a need to use both audio and visual media.

Asked about the need for a documentary, registrar Bharti said, “After joining the university, I was surprised to see that there is nothing in the university to depict our image in the public. On several occasions, it was embarrassing for us whenever they asked us to share any video or audio highlighting about the university campus.”

“BU has been an important campus in the state capital and has produced several talents. However, its image was also tarnished on several occasions in the past. Our attempt is to tell the youths that they can make a good career by studying in the university,” said registrar Bharti. The executive council has given the green signal to registrar in this regard.

About the documentary, Bharti said Rs 8 lakh will be given to Madhyam. “As I wanted full transparency, it was better for us to ask Madhyam for making the documentary. It will be a 10-minute documentary, focusing on the university’s achievements,” said Bharti.

Madhyam was created as a platform, on which communication needs of the government of Madhya Pradesh and its various departments and agencies could be fulfilled with a high degree of professionalism and freedom of creativity. Data has been collected from different BU departments for making the documentary. “The documentary will show the available infrastructure, students, teachers, employees and achievements. I have directed the departments of the university to provide authentic and true data for the documentary. We will also try to use small clips of our students, teachers as well as players who study here and play at the national and international level,” said Bharti.

Title: Delhi’s Naidu gang member killed, another hurt in infighting
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Meerut: Honey, a member of Delhi-based Naidu gang, was killed while another member Tilak Raj was shot at in what is seen as a fallout within the gang, largely owing to internal rivalry.

According to police, the incident occurred on Khirwa road under Kankerkhera police station in Meerut on Thursday night when onlookers alerted police over shootout involving occupants in a car.

As per the preliminary interrogation, it is revealed that Shiv Shakti Naidu, one of Delhi’s most notorious gangsters and kingpin of Naidu gang, and others opened fire at Honey and Tilak and later fled from the spot. Honey who succumbed at the spot had sustained five bullet wounds while Tilak is currently in a critical condition with four bullet injuries.

A local property dealer Rituraj has also come under the scanner. “He (Rituraj) was detained on Friday evening and a thorough interrogation is underway to establish the motive behind the shootout to get to the bottom of the case,” said Meerut SP City Akhilesh Narayan Singh. It was learnt from the local sleuths that a meeting was held at a flat in Kankerkhera area on Thursday evening and later they went towards the highway where the shootout took place.

“When the police reached the spot, they found a man lying dead on the driver’s seat while another victim who had sustained four bullet injuries was also lying close by. A pistol and several cartridges were also recovered from the car’s back seat,” Meerut SSP Ajay Sahni said. The injured was identified as criminal Tilak Raj while the deceased was identified as Tilak’s nephew Honey, according to cops.

Meanwhile, according to senior police officials, the gang was planning to assassinate a senior Delhi cop who had slapped stringent Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA) on Shakti Naidu and others following a Rs 7.8 crore dacoity in Delhi’s Lajpat Nagar in 2014.

“Tilak during interrogation claimed that Naidu and others were planning to assassinate a senior Delhi cop of the rank of additional commissioner of police. Naidu allegedly went berserk after Tilak and his nephew Honey refused to be part of the assassination plan,” a source close to TOI in the department said.

Shakti Naidu, who was out on bail, had come to limelight following the Lajpat Nagar dacoity and is considered one of the most notorious gangsters in Delhi. In November 2017, three members of the gang, including two of Naidu’s relatives, were arrested from south Delhi.

Title: After 570 deaths last year, Allahabad police to do road accident analysis of each case
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: In the light of 570 deaths in over 1,300 cases of road accidents last year in the district, traffic police authorities have taken up a Post Accident Analysis (PAA) exercise of every road accident reported in the city, Trans Ganga and Trans Yamuna pockets of the district.

As many as 570 people lost their lives and 913 others were injured in 1,365 road accidents in the city in 2019.

Allahabad SSP Satyarth Anirudh Pankaj told TOI, “A team of traffic police officials have launched Post Accident Analysis exercise of each road accident case separately to find out the exact reason behind them.”

“The exercise has been launched in both rural and urban areas of the district. The team will then prepare a detailed chart listing the reason behind road accidents in fatal and non-fatal categories. A list of accident prone areas (black spots) will also be included,” he added.

“Once the final report arrives, the decision on the status of black spots will be reviewed accordingly. The PAA report will be out by the end of February,” said the SSP.

In the exercise, the road accidents cases will be categorized based on various factors including over speeding, rash driving, road structure design, forced entry into no entry zones, wrong side driving and tipsy driving.

As per the data released by Allahabad police last year, around 63% of fatal and non-fatal road accidents recorded were attributed to rash driving and violation of speed limits.

The 2019 road accident statistics show that the highest number of road accident deaths were reported in June (71) followed by 68 in March, 59 in May, 56 in February, 47 in April, 44 in November, 43 in October, 42 in January, 38 in August, 35 in July, 33 in December and 30 in September.

The traffic police authorities had, in December last year, prescribed speed limits of heavy/commercial four and two-wheeler vehicles for 56 identified roads.

“We are making sincere efforts to arrest the graph of road accidents. Directives have also been issued to traffic cops to tighten noose around speed limit violators and rash drivers,” said the SSP.

Title: Woman found murdered, hubby accuses neighbour in Uttar Pradesh
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: A 40-year-old woman , identified as Rekha Devi was found murdered at Poorebabu village under the Kandhai police station of Pratapgarh district on Friday morning. Her body was found near a field with deep injuries on neck.

The woman reportedly left for fields on Thursday midnight. SP (Pratapgarh) Abhishek Singh said that police have launched investigation and the body has been sent for autopsy. “Local police were alerted about recovery of a woman’s body at a field outside Poorebabu village at around 7am. The woman was identified as Rekha Devi, wife of Ram Asre Patel,” said the SP.

The couple went to sleep after dinner on Thursday night but later Rekha was found missing on Friday morning, said the police.

Rekha’s husband, in FIR lodged with Kandhai police station, has accused his neighbour Prem Chandra Patel of killing his wife. Motive behind the crime is yet to be ascertained, said the police.

Title: Yug killer also behind theft at Chandak clinic
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Nagpur: There is a fresh twist in the kidnapping and murder case of eight-year-old Yug Chandak , which would now be heard before the Supreme Court (SC) on February 11. One of the two convicts has been charged with burglary for allegedly tipping off a thief who had stolen valuables from the clinic of Yug’s parents at Darodkar Square.

The SC counsel for Maharashtra has now written to the Nagpur Central Jail and also Lakadganj police station seeking background and behaviour report of the two convicts Rajesh Daware and Arvind Singh who have appealed in the SC against their death sentence.

While Lakadganj police has already sent the report, prison officials are waiting for some formalities to get over before they can reply to the counsel’s mail.

The duo was held for kidnapping and murder of Yug, a Std II student, for ransom on September 1, 2014. Their death sentence was upheld by the Nagpur bench of Bombay high court in 2016.

It’s learnt, Daware and Singh were kept at the lock-up of Sadar police station after their arrest. In the custody, the two had met two burglars. Daware, the mastermind behind the kidnapping and murder, befriended one of the burglars and briefed him about the cash and other valuables kept at the clinic of Yug’s parents Dr Mukesh and Dr Premal.

Daware, a former employee of Yug’s father, was miffed with the dentist for having fired him from the job.

The burglar and his accomplice decamped with substantial valuables from the clinic in 2015. Though the burglars were arrested by Lakadganj police station, the then investigation officer did not mention about Daware’s role in the crime.

Last year, an additional supplementary charge sheet filed in the burglary case named Daware as one of the accused.

Meanwhile, when the kidnapping and murder case came up for hearing before the SC in 2018, the bench wanted report of the background and behaviour of the two appellants lodged in Nagpur Central jail. As the case is set to now come up again, the counsel for Maharashtra state has sought a similar kind of report in advance with latest updates.

Title: Parties concerned over Kerala cops’ partisan approach
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Kozhikode: Concerns have been raised from various corners over the perceived pro-Sangh Parivar attitude of the Kerala police in dealing with the developments after the introduction of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act ( CAA ). The allegation is that police are taking a partisan approach while dealing with a section of the community.

The latest example cited is the case registered against SDPI workers who protested when Sangh Parivar activists took out a march in Vadakara on Thursday. The Sangh Parivar staged a protest alleging that there was local support for the accused in the Kaliyikkavila case. Vadakara police registered cases against both the groups but Section of IPC 153 (wantonly giving provocation with intent to cause riot) was charged against SDPI workers.

Similarly, Mannuthy police registered a case against Welfare Party of India state secretary K Sajeed under Section 153 of IPC for a Facebook post against police. “My post was on the incident of a person named Babu attacking a middle-aged woman Jameela at Mullakkara in Thrissur, asking her to leave the country. In the post, I said police are trying to make the accused a mentally unstable person. Now, police have registered a case against me too,” Sajeed told TOI.

Thrissur police, however, said Babu has been charged with Sections 323, 341 and 354 of the IPC. A case was registered against Sajeed for posting a baseless comment that the accused had shouted at the woman to go to Pakistan. The accused was violent when he was brought to the police station and he was sent to mental health centre, police said.

“The government says one thing and police are moving in another direction. Pinarayi Vijayan and the CPM said they are against the UAPA, but police slapped the law on Allan Shuhaib and Twaha Fasal. There is something mysterious about the pro-Sangh Parivar attitude of the Kerala police,” said Musthafa Kommeri, secretary of the SDPI.

Title: ‘If needed, Air India will send another flight to evacuate Indians in China’
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Ashwani Lohani

Vadodara: Air India has started to evacuate Indians from Wuhan, China on Friday. And if necessary another flight may depart on Saturday.

This is what chairman and managing director (CMD) of Air India Ashwani Lohani told media persons here. Lohani was in Vadodara to attend 69th foundation day ceremony of National Academy of Indian Railways (NAIR).

“We will evacuate Indians from Wuhan, the site of outbreak of coronavirus,” said Lohani, former chairman of Railway Board, who was conferred with the distinguished alumnus award during the ceremony. Professor Errol D’Souza, director of IIM-Ahmedabad, was the chief guest.

A special flight — double decker jumbo with 15 cabin crew and five cockpit crew — departed from Indira Gandhi International Airport, New Delhi for Wuhan for evacuation of Indians on Friday noon. The flight may return to New Delhi from Wuhan (China) on Saturday morning.

NAIR’s director general (DG) S P S Chauhan informed that the academy had received the prestigious 'Golden peacock nation training award’ in 2019. Lohani said the greatest resource of an organization- especially of Indian Railways- is its manpower. Recollecting his days as Railway Board chairman, he said he had banned bouquets and culture of gifts.

“I think that culture has started returning. It did not get deeply ingrained,” he said, stressing that all officers of Indian Railways are ‘servants of Indian people.’

Medals and awards were given away to 60 officers of different levels of seniority for their outstanding achievements in various fields and activities during training at NAIR. The DG medals for Group-A and foundation courses (2018 and 2019) went to Akshay Gangarwal and Rajeev Chaudhari, respectively. DG’s medals for Group- A and medical foundation (2018 and 2019) went to Dr Shivangi Shukla and Dr Asha Kalwar, respectively.

Title: Workers of Bicholim firm demand full pay
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Bicholim: Workers of a mining company in Bicholimwho are presently being paid just half their salaryon Friday requested speaker Rajesh Patnekar and Mayem MLA Pravin Zantye to hold talks with the company in order to resolve the issue. The workers met Patnekar and Zantye when the duo visited Mayem to attend a function. Stating that the remuneration they presently draw is insufficient for their sustenance, they urged the two politicians to convince the mining company to pay them their salaries in full. The workers further said that if their demands were not met, they would be left with no alternative but to sit outside the houses of their local representatives, including that of the chief minister.

Patnekar and Zantye told the workers that they were already working to resolve the issue. They also assured the workers a meeting with chief minister Pramod Sawant. tnn

Title: Man murdered after brawl at liquor den on dry day
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Nagpur: A 27-year-old man was stabbed and thrashed to death following a brawl at a liquor den at Minimata Nagar in Kalamna on Thursday, which was declared dry day by the district administration on account of Mahatma Gandhi death anniversary.

The prime accused is brother of a woman with whom the victim, Roshan Chourasiya, allegedly had an illicit relationship.

Kalamna police, despite the arrest of the prime accused Raj Bharti, are under scanner as the crime took place at a notorious liquor den of bootlegger Meenabai. Sources in the locality said the den is known for making liquor available in black market, especially on dry days, in connivance with local policing network.

Kalamna police have refuted the allegations of liquor being available in the area on dry day.

The victim had an affair with Meenabai’s married daughter who is a mother of three. “Chourasiya and Bharti were at loggerheads over the victim’s relationship with Meenabai's daughter. They had got into scuffles during the last couple of days,” said a source close to Chourasiya.

Chourasiya was murdered when he was celebrating a friend’s birthday at the liquor den. Chourasiya had purchased liquor worth Rs1,500 at the den and was openly enjoying with music.

Chourasiya had left home with Rs2,000. “He had purchased each bottle for Rs250 from the den,” said Chourasiya’s friend.

Sources said that Chourasiya was seated with Meenabai’s daughter and trying to persuade her to leave her family when Bharti spotted them. Bharti and Chourasiya got into a heated argument, leading to a drunken brawl. Bharti's sister fled the spot when the murder took place. Her slippers were at the spot when police reached there, said sources.

Bharti, along with his friends Akash Mehta and others, thrashed Chourasiya to death before smashing his head with a boulder. Mehta is on the run.

It’s learnt Chourasiya too was allegedly involved in the murder of his friend-turned-foe Raja Ghantala at red light area of Ganga Jamuna in 2016. He was released from jail around a year ago. After release, he had been driving auto-rickshaw to earn livelihood.

Chourasiya’s elder brother Ajay too was externed twice in the past.

Zonal DCP Neelotpal said that he would look into the issue of availability of liquor on dry day.

Title: Terrace seats for tourists to enjoy Gair festivities
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Indore: When Indore district administration is promoting Gair to make it to UNESCO list of Intangible Cultural Heritage, Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC) has gone a step further to promote the Rang Panchmi procession by planning to provide aerial view of the event to tourists from terraces along procession route.

The corporation under guidance of district administration has identified residential and commercial buildings along procession route from where visitors and tourists can witness this famous procession, which is taken out on fifth day after Holi.

IMC commissioner Asheesh Singh said that the initiative has been taken up under guidance of district administration. “We have identified around 100 buildings along the procession route that have basic facilities like adequate seating area on terrace, water, food, toilets etc. We are considering using these building to offer tourists an option to witness the procession from terrace of these buildings,” commissioner told TOI.

He said that this is an initial plan and a final decision in this regard would be taken in a joint meeting with district administration and tourism department scheduled on Saturday.

“Gair is an international festival. We are considering promoting it for tourism. We are targeting both local as well as foreign tourists by providing them all basic amenities to enjoy this annual procession. If all goes well, it would help us to get this festival listed under UNESCO list of Intangible Cultural Heritage,” he added.

Official sources said that around 50-70 of identified property on 2.5km procession route between Tori Corner and Malharganj Main Road have all necessary arrangements and at least 700 people can be accommodated in them.

According to historians, Rang Panchmi celebrations in city used to be for 15 days in times of Tukojirao Maharaj II. This tradition started between 1844 and 1866. During Rang Panchmi, maharaja used to hold a darbar. Later, the festival became public and various organisations held processions in a grand way.

Title: Two traffic brigade jawans among four held for looting trader
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

The four had committed a loot in Khambat taluka on January 27

Vadodara: The detection of crime branch (DCB) has arrested four men including two traffic brigade personnel for looting a man in Anand.

The cops arrested the accused for ferrying liquor and during investigations it came to light that they had also committed a loot in Khambat taluka on January 27.

One of the accused had promised Shailesh Patel, a trader in Khambat, that he will double his money in a short time. Patel believed his promise and turned up at Piploi bus stand with Rs 4 lakh.

He met accused Ishwar Solanki there and showed the cash. In some time, a car came there and two men got down. The duo and Ishwar Solanki then caught hold of Patel and fled with the cash.

The Khambat police registered an offence against unidentified men. Meanwhile, Vadodara crime branch arrested four men including Jayraj Hathila and Sanjay Kumar Solanki, who work with traffic brigade, and Surendra Barjod and Sunil Kalra from Gotri area on January 28. The cops seized liquor stock from their car along with Rs 3.94 lakh cash.

When questioned, the accused admitted to have looted Patel in Anand.

The accused also told the police that they had hidden many more liquor bottles at Sanjay’s house in Anand.

Over 550 liquor bottles worth Rs 1.65 lakh were seized from his home.

Title: Now, Disha app to make streets safer for women
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Vijayawada: Very soon women in Andhra Pradesh can send a distress signal to the police just by shaking their mobile phone thanks to the technological advancements made by the state police. Apart from bringing Disha Act to ensure justice to rape victims within 21 days, the state government is also bringing in various preventive measures for women safety.

As part of the preventive safety measures, the state police have designed a state of the art mobile application with advanced features through which women can send a distress signal just by shaking their mobile phone. The feature that is available in Andriod and IOS smart phones will send an SOS to the control room with location coordinates, and a ten seconds video footage from the time the SOS call originated. The app was designed in such a way that the phone’s camera will activate and records the video and send it to command control centre so that cops to have an idea about the status of the victim.

The police have taken certain measures to avoid false signals. The shake trigger will activate only after shaking the phone five times. There is also an option of disabling video recording to avoid privacy issues. All control rooms across the state will be integrated with the Disha App and specially-trained personnel will be designated to deal with the complaints coming from Disha App.

A senior official who played a major role in designing the app said that the app is aimed to ensure safety of the women. In many cases, the victims may not get a chance to unlock their phone and call the police. “The shake trigger and video recording feature will ensure safety even without calling police directly. Our teams will be deployed based on the coordinates we receive even though we could not be able to talk to the victim directly,” the anonymous senior official said.

Apart from the shake trigger feature, cops have also included a feature in the mobile application to share a route map while travelling in private transport vehicles which will alert the police if the vehicle deviates from the route. Users can also access information about and phone numbers of nearest police stations, nearest hospitals and blood banks, in case of an emergency. The app, which is in advanced stages of testing, will be launched by chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy soon.

Title: TTD reviews prep for Radhasaptami festival
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Tirupati: TTD executive officer (EO) Anil Kumar Singhal on Friday inspected the arrangements for the annual Radhasaptami festival at Tirumala .

Accompanied by additional EO AV Dharma Reddy, CVSO Gopinath Jatti and other officials, the EO inspected the galleries in the four mada streets around the main temple complex.

Speaking to reporters, the EO said the temple administration spent nearly Rs 1.6 crore to construct German shelter sheds along the galleries around the mada streets for devotees.

The TTD has also made elaborate security arrangements for the festival by engaging the services of 300 TTD security guards, 1,000 police personnel from the Tirupati urban police wing, 600 NCC cadets, and scouts and guides.

The TTD has set up 64 food counters and procured 1.75 lakh half-litre water bottles, two lakh buttermilk sachets for devotees. The series of seven processions will begin at 5.30 am on Saturday and continue till 9 pm.

Meanwhile, K Sivaprasad, a disciple of Carnatic music maestro M Balamuralikrishna, performed ‘sankeerthans’ through whistle at a programme in Tirumala on Friday.

Title: Govt to build 22 new fishing harbours along the coast
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Amaravati: In a move to create better avenues for fishermen, the state government will build at least 22 new fishing harbours along the coast and develop the existing facilities.

The fisheries department has readied a blueprint for the development of fishing harbours. A study was conducted to identify locations to construct major and minor harbours.

In the first phase, four major harbours would be taken up and another four harbours in the second phase. Each harbor would be constructed at a cost of Rs 350 crore. The government is planning to secure 50% funds from the Centre as Andhra Pradesh is the highest producer of marine products giving massive revenue to the exchequer.

“The Centre is willing to help the state as increased avenues for fishermen is indirectly helping the Centre raking up huge revenue through export of marine products,” said fisheries minister Mopidevi Venkata Ramana.

He said that the Centre had responded to give Rs 100 crore for renovation of Visakhapatnam fishing harbour .

The construction of major harbours at Machilipatnam (Krishna), Vadarevu (Prakasam), Juvvaladinne (Nellore) and Uppada (East Godavari) would be taken up in the first phase during the current fiscal itself. The works on the remaining four major harbours one each at Kothapatnam (Prakasam) Pudimadaka (Visakhapatnam), Edduvanipalem (Srikakulam), Budagatlapalem (Srikakulam) would be taken up under second phase in the next fiscal.

The government had identified another 14 locations for construction of minor jettys to help fishermen increase the operations. “The CM has directed us to take up all measures required to improve infrastructure after fishermen were released from Pakistan and Bangladesh jails. The creation of more facilities would help fishermen to focus on their livelihood along the AP’s coast instead of going elsewhere,” said Ramana.

He said that the department was planning to encourage fishermen to go for cage-culture for providing better returns.

Title: PSU bank strike cripples services on Day 1
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Employees of PSU banks protest at RBI Square (Pic by Ranjit Deshmukh)

Nagpur: More than 4,000 government bank employees took to the streets on Friday as part of two-day all-India strike seeking pay hike.

This was the second bank strike in a month, first being on January 8.

With the agitation scheduled to continue on Saturday also, transactions worth more than Rs6,000 crore in all PSU banks’ branches in Vidarbha are expected to be hit, say union sources.

Even as there have been independent estimates of 4,000 employees taking part in the protest rally, bank unions have claimed that nearly 7,000 were present.

“Before this, a strike against government’s economic policies was observed on January 8. However, the crowd that gathered on Friday was unprecedented,” said Jaiwant Gurway, general secretary of Eastern Maharashtra Bank Employees Association (EMBEA).

The strike has been called to press for a 20% hike in the payslip components. The unions are also demanding hike in family pension, defined working hours for offices and equal wage for equal work to contract workers apart from five-day week etc. The unions say that wage revision is due since 2017. As against the demand of 20% hike, the Indian Banks Association (IBA), which represents management, has offered increase at 12.5%.

According to union sources, cheques worth Rs2,800 crore on an average are cleared in a day in all PSU bank branches in Vidarbha. Apart from it, bills worth Rs500 crore are also discounted. All the functions had come to a standstill due to the strike on Friday and work will be hit on Saturday too.

Unions in State Bank of India (SBI) generally remain away from the strike calls. However, this time even the SBI unions have joined the agitation leading to a major impact on banking business, said sources.

Title: Industries wants sops to revive economy
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Nagpur: Industries of the region want a variety of sops to grow at a good rate and help revive the economy. Local industry captains have pegged a lot of hope on the 2020-21 Union Budget.

Nitin Lonkar, president of Butibori Manufacturers Association (BMA), said that more funds should be made available to micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs). “Banks do not entertain MSMEs. They should be set a target for lending to this sector. Moreover, the interest rate for the sector should be reduced,” he added.

According to Lonkar, ease of doing business should be improved for the sector, and the ambit of government e-marketplace (GeM) portal should be increased, so that MSMEs get a platform to market their products.

Chandrashekhar Shegaonkar, president of Hingna MIDC Industries Association (MIA), said that the rate of goods and services tax (GST) should be reduced and personal income tax (IT) exemption limit should be increased to Rs5 lakh.

“Agriculture should be given the status of an industry. Small farmers are often unable to manage their farms, so if industrialists are allowed to undertake corporate farming, corporates can buy their land and do farming profitably,” Shegaonkar added.

Suresh Rathi, president of Vidarbha Industries Association (VIA), said that he did not have much expectations from the budget, as the government did not have enough money after the slowdown in economy. “However, if the government invests Rs100 lakh crore on infrastructure, it will boost the economy. Personal IT should be reduced so that people have money in their hands. Exports should be stimulated,” Rathi said.

“Corporate dividend tax must go, if you want people to invest. Ease of doing business for industries should be real and tangible at the grassroots,” he added.

Madhusudan Rungta, president of Chandrapur MIDC Industries Association, said that IT exemption should be increased to Rs10 lakh. “Banks should do discounting for MSMEs if their payment is delayed. Agro-industries should be given 30% transport subsidy, so that units far away from big cities get a level playing field,” he added.

Umesh Malu, president of Akola Industries Association, said that all tax payment should be faceless, along the lines of IT; and that the rate of interest for MSMEs should be between 2% and 3%. “Countries like South Korea are able to export a lot of goods because their industries get very cheap loans. They agree to take payment three years later. We cannot do that,” he added.

Malu further said that there should a comprehensive audit for all taxes and compulsory payments like provident fund. “I should not be required to go to the chartered accountant ten times a year for different compliances. They should need to do it only once for all departments,” he added.

Title: Depositors of Mapusa Urban Cooperative Bank to protest on Monday
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

SALIGAO: Aggrieved stakeholders and depositors of Mapusa Urban Cooperative Bank (MUCB) across all branches will hold a peaceful protest in front of the bank’s headquarters at Mapusa on February 3.

In a press release, the stakeholders have stated that the meeting to be held from 10.30am to 12.30pm, “is to express the unwarranted grief and misery imposed on them due to the financial irregularities and mismanagement by the board of directors that led to Reserve Bank of India (RBI) imposing sanctions on the bank’s operations”.

MUCB needs around Rs 50 crore as share capital infusion in order to come out of RBI’s financial sanctions that end on February 18, or else the bank faces liquidation.

“Unlike the Punjab and Maharashtra Cooperative Bank case, it is incomprehensible to the depositors why RBI has delayed to initiate similar criminal investigations for financial fraud against the MUCB’s board of directors. These unwarranted hardships are forced upon the depositors, depriving them of their funds due to mismanagement by the board. The depositors, comprising senior citizens, small-time traders, entrepreneurs, teachers, etc, are in urgent need of their hard-earned money due to various personal exigencies,” the stakeholders stated.

Title: Constitution has ‘Lakshman rekha’ for states: Lalji Tandon
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Madhya Pradesh Governor Lalji Tandon with Chief Justice of MP High Chourt Justice Ravi Shankar Jha after admin... Read More

BHOPAL: After the Governor of Kerala Arif Mohammad Khan , Madhya Pradesh Governor Lalji Tandon too stated that Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) cannot be stopped from implementation by the state government, thereby fueling speculations of a conflict-like situation with the Kamal Nath government if it decides not to implement the new law.

“There is a Laxman-rekha (restriction) in the Constitution for state governments,” he said speaking to reporters during the inauguration of the new media room in the Raj Bhawan here on Friday.

“Any Bill passed by the Lok Sabha , Rajya Sabha and thereafter, with the assent of the President becomes a law. So, which state in the country can deny implementing it?” the Governor asked.

There are ten states including MP that have refused to implement the law including West Bengal , Punjab, Maharashtra, Kerala. On December 25, chief minister Kamal Nath told the media, “So long as Congress is running the government in Madhya Pradesh, no anti-Constitution, anti-people and anti-religion law will be implemented here.”

Addressing a public meeting recently, the chief minister had said, “Our country’s identity is our culture to unite in diversity. The attack today is not just on our Constitution but on the rights of every citizen. Our patriarchs like Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar framed the Constitution to unite the diversity and multiplicity of our nation under one flag. Today, that has been attacked. The kind of law that has been passed endangers our rights and the future. Let us all raise our voices to protest it.”

Speaking about the role of the Governors in case of conflict with the state government on the issue, Tandon said, “After taking over the office of Governor, one is committed to work within the provisions of the Constitution, no matter which political background he comes from. A Governor works according to the Constitution.”

When asked, what he appreciates most about the Congress government in the state, the Governor said chief minister Kamal Nath is upholding the “Sanatan culture” and I like him for that. He welcomed the state government’s decision to construct the Ram Van Gaman Path from Chitrakoot, the grand Sita temple in Sri Lanka and the recitation of the Hanuman Chalisa on Mahatma Gandhi death anniversary.

Meanwhile, state Congress spokesman Narendra Saluja took a dig at the BJP. He tweeted, “Today His Excellency the Governor praised the state government’s decisions taken for welfare of the people in the past one year and the construction of Ram Van Gaman Path, Sita Mata temple and recital of Hanuman Chalisa. Don’t know when BJP’s good sense will prevail.”

Title: Contaminated water leaves Navayard residents fuming
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Residents of the area held demonstrations on Friday

Vadodara: The problem of contaminated water continues to embarass Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC).

Tempers were frayed in Navayard area over supply of dirty water.

Residents of the area held demonstrations in Amarnagar locality demanding clean water and alleged that a girl had died due to water borne diseases.

The residents claimed that they had been getting contaminated water since several days now and VMC had not been able to take care of the situation.

They alleged that a girl Urvashi Jadav residing in the Datta Park locality had died after severe diarrhoea and vomiting as she took ill.

The residents of Gayatridham Society, Amarnagar and surrounding areas assembled in Amarnagar to protest against the failure of the civic body to supply them clean water. They smashed earthen water pots during the protest.

Title: Watch Kathakali with Hindi, Eng commentary
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Guru Raju N from Bangalore performed Kuchipudi dance on the inaugural day of Pratibhotsavam a two day All Indi... Read More

Nagpur: The beauty of painted faces and amazing postures in performing Kathakali dance takes everyone’s breath away, but what goes behind to put this act together is the script and story selected from mythology.

People, especially non-Malayalis, often fail to understand the essence of these stories since it is narrated in Malayalam. Now, here is an opportunity for all Kathakali lovers to understand the story as the songs will be accompanied by Hindi and English commentary.

Kathakali dance drama ‘Narakasuravadham (the death of Narakasura)’ will be performed at 7pm on Sunday as part of the ongoing three-day All-India Classical Dance Competition and Festival being held at Sai Sabhagruh.

Janardhanan Nair of Pratibha Natya Mandir believes the commentary will attract all dance lovers. “The narration is always in Malayalam. As Nagpur is a multi-lingual city, we wanted people to understand the storyline so that they could enjoy the performance to the fullest,” he said.

Manish Nair, who will be doing the commentary, said,“Kathakali reflects Malayalam culture. Hence, we decided to use Hindi and English to make the performance more people friendly. The story of Narakasura will sure be liked by Kathakali lovers,” he said.

The act will be performed by Kalamamdalam Adthiyan and troupe from Kerala. The story of Narakasuravadham revolves around demon king Narakasura who deputes Nakrathundi to capture damsels from heaven. The demoness travels to heaven, nabs a few and starts her return journey.

“On her way, Nakrathundi meets young and handsome Jayantha, son of Indra. Attracted to him, the demoness approaches Jayantha in the guise of beautiful Lalitha. She reveals her longing for Jayantha, but he turns down her proposal for marriage,” said Manish, explaining the story.

A disappointed Lalitha then turns into ferocious Nakrathundi and tries to abduct Jayantha. In the tussle that follows, Jayantha mutilates Nakrathundi by cutting off her ears, nose and breasts. The rest of the story is about the revenge of Narakasura who defeats Indra, but is later killed by Lord Krishna.

“The performers are on their way to present their art in all its glory. However, the songs will be in Malayali,” said Rajan Nambiar, president of NSS.

Diwali sybolizes the victory of Lord Krishna over Narkasura--good over evil.

Title: Ahead of budget, AIKMS seeks cut in agriculture input cost
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

ALLAHABAD: A day before the presentation of the Union budget on Saturday, the all India Kisan Majdoor Sangh (AIKMS) has demanded reduction in input prices of agriculture , diesel, seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and electricity by half. While input costs have risen by 33 to 100 % in last five years, the cost of living has more than doubled, said AIKMS .

General secretary, AIKMS, said that input support through PMKISAN at Rs 6,000 per year is too meagre and should be raised to Rs 6,000 per acre per crop. Budgetary support is required to pay a profitable minimal support price (MSP) of 1.5 times the cost of production for all crops and assured government procurement of all crops. In the last one year, distress sale of vegetables, pulses, oilseeds, wheat, rice, millets, milk, sugarcane, cotton caused huge losses and debs to peasants.

Budget should allot adequate funds for debt waiver. “The government has waived more than 2 lakh crores of bad debts of corporate and given them an additional tax concession of Rs 1.45 lakh crore. It should announce freedom from debt for all peasants including agricultural workers and including their private loans,” said Mittal.

AIKMS has also demanded that crop aggregation and marketing should be done through the government allocation of funds for building storage houses, cold storages, procurement, food processing facility which can be rented by farmers.

Title: CPI, CPM cadres lock horns in Nagai
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Nagapattinam: Tension prevailed at Kilvelur in the district following a clash between CPI and CPM cadres on Thursday night, during which a thatched hut of a CPM cadre was set ablaze. Police have registered a case against six CPM cadres.

According to the police, a few CPM cadres had joined the CPI at an event held on January 25. However, some more cadres from the party who had assured to join did not turn up at the function.

A group of CPI men went to the house of Venkatraman, 33, district treasurer of DYFI, who desisted from switching to CPI, and picked up an altercation with him on Thursday night. On getting information, CPM cadres rushed there and argued in support of Venkatraman. As the situation turned violent, they started to attack each other. During the incident members from both the groups including Venkatraman sustained minor injuries.

In a fit of rage, a group of people set fire the thatched hut of CPM cadre Achuthan, 45. The entire house was reduced to ashes during the incident. Following the incident, K Kamalakannan, 20, a resident of the village lodged a complaint with Keezhaiyur police.

Based on the complaint, police registered a case against six CPM cadres including Ramalingam, Ramu, Palanivel and further investigations are on.

Title: Goa: Mercury may dip further, but chill will not last long
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Wind direction and cloud cover are key factors for the drop in mercury

PANAJI: The mercury dropped to 20.1C on Friday morning as the pleasant chill was felt once again after some warm nights in an erratic winter season marked by higher minimum temperatures .

However, while the weather is likely to get even cooler, it may not remain constant for long. “We are not expecting it to go beyond 19C. But after February 2, the minimum temperature may start rising again,” Rahul M, scientist at the India meteorological department (IMD), Panaji, said.

December last year witnessed the warmest nights since the 1970s as the mercury did not drop below 21C even once. As the month is regarded to be the peak period of the mild winter season, temperatures below 20C were usually recorded by the meteorological department quite often in the past. December 2019, however, logged minimum temperatures of 24C on eight days and 23C on seven days.

In contrast, January 17, 2020, recorded a minimum temperature of 18.3C — the lowest of the season. But the mild chill was short-lived as minimum temperatures soon began rising due to overcast conditions and change of wind directions.

Earlier this week, the mercury even rose to 24C, while clear skies during the day triggered a rise in maximum temperature. In fact, IMD, Panaji recorded temperatures of over 35C on a couple of days.

Wind direction and cloud cover are key factors for the drop in mercury. While northeasterly winds bring in the chill from northern regions, easterly winds are warm.

Title: Two Ganga yatras culminate at Atal Ghat amidst Vedic chants
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

CM performs a ritual in the Ganga in Kanpur on Friday

KANPUR: The two Ganga yatras, which began from Bijnor and Ballia, culminated at Atal Ghat of Ganga in the city on Friday.

Chief minister Yogi Adityanath and his cabinet ministers welcomed the members of two yatras. They first took part in the ‘Aarti’ and later worshipped Ganga amid chanting of Vedic ‘mantras’.

Addressing a gathering, the CM said that residents of Kanpur knew that the city used to be the most critical point of Namami Gange Mission.

“Things have changed now. Earlier, aquatic life in Jajmau was in danger and could not survive but now they are breeding successfully. The Namami Gange Mission has made the river clean and clear. People are now taking a dip in the river”, Yogi said.

He said the two teams during the 1,338 km long five-day yatra have done many constructive works. He has appealed to the inhabitants of the Ganga bank not to use chemical to maintain the cleanliness of the river. He asked them to take a pledge to ensure the river’s cleanliness and its continuous flow.

Speaking on the occasion, deputy chief minister Keshav Prasad Maurya said that the Prime Minister and the chief minister, who had pledged to make the river clean, have achieved success up to some extent in their mission. Around 24.56 crore devotees had taken a dip in Ganga on the occasion of Kumbh 2019 and more than 48 crores are expected to take a dip in 2025 Kumbh, he said.

Jal shakti minister Mahendra Singh said Ganga was brought on the earth by Bhagirath and now two ‘Bhagiraths’ were trying to make it clean. State BJP president Swatantra Dev Singh said, “All of us should pledge to make Ganga clean and pollution-free.”

Title: Businesses hit in bank strike, personnel face 2-day pay cut
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

An empty office at a bank in Bhopal on Friday

Bhopal: Banking operations were completely paralyzed on Friday, the first day of the two-day nationwide strike of bank personnel. Even the locks could not be opened in a majority of about 4,500 bank branches in Madhya Pradesh.

Bank business worth several thousand crore was affected by the strike, that was called by the United Forum of Bank Unions (UFBU), an umbrella organisation of nine unions of bank employees and officials. These unions cover almost all the major banks, including some private banks.

The nationwide strike will also cost the baInk personnel dear as their two-day salary would be deducted. “It would collectively amount to be about Rs 300 crore in the two days,” a bank union leader said.

Spokesman of the UFBU in Bhopal, Gunshekharan, said, “If the issues of the bank personnel are not resolved, more such strikes will happen in the coming days.”

For the past 26 months, bank unions have been negotiating with the India Bank Association (IBA) to resolve their issues related to salary, pension and working days. They also want IBA to define the working hours of bank officials.

“Nothing has been done so far to resolve the long pending issues,” Gunshekharan said.

People were inconvenienced on the first day of the strike as they were not able to operate lockers or carry out NEFT operations. Cash deposits and withdrawals were also not done. Operations related to foreign currency and bank loans were also affected completely. People may also face cash crunch in the next two days as ATMs will also not be replenished and in case of any technical snag in the machines, there would be no back support of the banks because of the strike, a bank union leader said.

After the strike, banks will open on February 2.

If the deadlock continues, the bank personnel have proposed another strike on March 11, 12 and 13. “Effectively, the banks will be closed for six days. The proposed three-day strike will be preceded by Holi on March 10 and followed by second Saturday and Sunday on March 14 and 15.”

Title: SC to hear plea on disclosure of ministers’ graft cases under RTI
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Whistle-blower bureaucrat Sanjiv Chaturvedi (File photo)

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Friday agreed to hear a plea by whistle-blower bureaucrat Sanjiv Chaturvedi seeking disclosure, under the RTI Act, about corruption complaints received and action taken by the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) against Union ministers between 2014-17.

A bench comprising justices L Nageswara Rao and Hemant Gupta issued a notice to the central public information officer (CPIO) of the PMO and sought a response. Chaturvedi, a Magsaysay award winner, approached the apex court after his plea for disclosure of the information was rejected by the Delhi high court on September 6.

Chaturvedi, in his RTI application filed with the PMO in 2017, had sought details of corruption complaints against Union ministers, inquiries conducted into complaints and action taken against them. He had also sought information on the amount of black money brought from abroad which were illegally parked there by the influential and rich people of the country.

He said the high court order strikes at the very root of democratic rights of a citizen to know about transactions/ businesses being carried out in the government, and more specifically in this case about status of action taken on corruption complaints of its own elected representatives, and promises made during elections regarding black money.

Title: Teacher, nurse, doc posts will be priority: CM
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Amaravati: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy on Friday asked officials to ready the job calendar to fill vacancies in government departments based on a need-basis.

Holding a review meet on readying a recruitment calendar with senior officials, the CM asked officials to give priority to fill teacher posts in government schools and staff in hospitals.

The CM said their efforts to improve infrastructure in schools and hospitals under Naadu-Nedu would go waste if the required posts were not filled. He asked the officials to recruit lab technicians for schools in order to make students conduct trials in science laboratories.

He asked the officials to fill all vacancies of doctors, nurses and paramedical staff in hospitals to improve healthcare services. He said lab technicians and pharmacist posts should be filled to extend better services to people.

Stating that AP was the first state to give weekly-off to police personnel, the chief minister asked DGP to see that it should impact the performance of the department. He said revenue department should get priority in filling vacancies. He asked the officials to procure tools for survey staff in revenue department to expedite the work.

He also asked the APPSC secretary to discuss with each department and finalise the number of vacancies. He directed the officials to come with a plan in three weeks. Minister for civil supplies Kodali Nani, chief secretary Nilam Sawhney, DGP Gautham Sawang and APPSC secretary PSR Anjaneyulu were present during the review.

Title: Two dead as bike collides with RTC bus
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Vijayawada: Two youngsters died on the spot when their bike collided with an RTC bus at Kanamarlapudi village of Savalyapuram mandal in Guntur district on Friday. The deceased were identified as Veeresh (23), from Raichur district, and Basavaraj (25), from Narinal village under Kanigiri Taluk, both in Karnataka.

According to Savalyapuram police, the incident happened in the morning when the two youths were transporting a harvesting machine towards Savalyapuram to harvest paddy on their agricultural field. Cops said that the youngsters lost control of their vehicle at a sharp turning where they collided with a speeding RTC bus, which killed them on the spot. Citing eyewitnesses, the police said that both the bike and the bus were overspeeding at the turning.

The police shifted their bodies to a local government hospital for post-mortem. A case under section 304A of IPC (causing death due to negligence) was registered against the bus driver.

Title: Onion farmers seek relief for crop loss
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Onion farmers are demanding compensation from the government as pests have damaged their crop raised on hundre... Read More

TRICHY: Onion farmers from Thuraiyur, Mannachanallur and Uppiliapuram are demanding compensation from the government as pests have damaged their crop raised on hundreds of acres, at the grievance day meeting held at the collectorate here on Friday. A section of farmers have also urged the government to ban Andhra Ponni paddy seed as their crop have been affected by pest and rice blast disease.

They have appealed the officials to commence enumeration of farmers who have been affected and staged a protest by bringing the damaged crops on their head.

Speaking at the meeting, Tamilaga Vivasayigal Sangam (affiliated to CPM) state secretary R Raja Chidambaram said that 5,000 acres of onion crop was completely damaged due to downy mildew pest. “Farmers had spent Rs 50,000 to raise the crop per acre.”

“Considering shortage of water, farmers usually cultivate short duration onion crops. The cold storage facility established at Chetticulam in Perambalur has failed to yield benefits but the facility in Tuticorin is functioning well. Agriculture department should construct such cold storage to help onion farmers,” he added.

“Following downy mildew pest which was caused by fungus-like organism Peronospora destructor, the pest first damages the leaves and later the bulbs of small onions. As the weather was humid in November 2019, 80% of small onion cultivated in Thuraiyur, Uppiliyapuram, Mannachanallur and Pullambadi blocks in Trichy district and major areas in Perambalur district were infected by the downy mildew infection. Incessant rains was also stated to be the reason for the crop loss,” agriculture officials said while replying to farmers.

District collector S Sivarasu has assured to commence the enumeration of crop loss and assured to recommend compensation to the affected farmers.

The farmers’ wing of Tamil Manila Congress brought damaged crop of Andhra Ponni paddy and showed it to the collector. “Farmers who raised Andhra Ponni (BPT 5204) lost their crop due to pest and rice blast disease attack this year.

Title: Aqua conclave from February 6 to 8
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Vijayawada: Andhra Pradesh will be hosting the third edition of Aquaex India 2020—which showcases Indian fisheries and aquaculture growth—from February 6 to 8, at Peda Amiram area of Bhimavaram mandal in West Godavari district on Friday.

The event is touted to be South Asia’s largest aqua conclave, with over 25,000 people set to participate in the the three-day event which will see leading exhibitors from the fishery and aquaculture industries from across the world showcase their expertise.

Announcing the objective behind Aquaex India 2020, founder of Aquaex Venu Dantuluri said: “As the appetite for seafood is growing globally, our idea is to create a global platform for Indian fisheries and aquaculture by bringing the latest technologies, services, equipment and machinery across the globe for their benefit.”

“Through this expo we want to showcase Andhra Pradesh fishery’s trade potential and open the doors to thousands of seafood professionals from around the globe seeking to grow their businesses in the Indian fisheries market. AP is known for its 975-km-long coastline, which is recognised as a source of unrivalled fresh seafood and has a historic fishing community,” Venu added.

Over the years, the focus has shifted from capture fisheries to aquaculture. In the last four decades, aquaculture emerged as the major source for increasing fish production and farmers from the state have led the way by making it, the single largest state for fisheries production in India.

Title: Budget: Delta rail users expect stress on infrastructure development
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: As finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman prepares to present the Union budget in Parliament on Saturday, railway associations are hoping that there will be announcements on infrastructure development in the delta districts. The establishment of a railway production unit and coach maintenance facility in Kumbakonam and a MEMU shed at Mayiladuthurai in Trichy railway division are some of the expectations.

The provision for establishing the unit in Tirunageswaram near Kumbakonam utilizing the 40 acres of vacant railway land will provide many direct and indirect employment opportunities and improve the economic condition of this agrarian region. Railways has many production units to make coaches, wagons, wheels, concrete sleepers etc, apart from reconditioning workshops, advisor of Thanjavur District Rail Users Association, A Giri said.

“Unlike other divisions in Southern Railway , coach maintenance facility exists only in Trichy division at Trichy and Villupuram. There is a long-pending demand for a coach maintenance facility in the 144-year-old Thanjavur-Villupuram mainline section,” he said.

A MEMU (mainline electric multiple unit) shed at Mayiladuthurai will enable the operation of such trains in lieu of presently operated conventional passenger or DEMU trains, he said. “Mayiladuthurai which is centrally located in Trichy division and having adequate land space will be the ideal place to establish a MEMU shed to serve the entire division.”

“Villupuram - Thanjavur - Trichy section is highly passenger oriented and has many important tourist and pilgrimage centres. As one of the important sections in Southern Railway, doubling of Thanjavur - Villupuram section (193km) with necessary fund allocation in the budgetary proposals of 2020-21 must be announced,” Giri said.

Meanwhile, deputy general secretary of Dakshin Railway Employees Union (DREU) D Manoharan said that Rs 20,000 crore annual fund for railway safety should be allotted from the exchequer instead of the existing practice of allotment from internal resources. After the budget merger, dividends of railway public sectors go to the exchequer. It should be credited into the railway account, he insisted.

“For employees, income tax ceiling should be raised to Rs 15 lakh and the standard deduction should be Rs 5 lakh. The fund should be allocated to execute staff welfare programmes like a hostel for railway employees’ children in major cities, construction of crèches at 20 divisional offices as announced in previous budgets,” Manoharan said.

Title: Man booked for harassing young woman
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: The Woraiyur police have registered a case against a man for harassing a 20-year-old woman by sharing her pictures on Facebook and WhatsApp in Trichy on Thursday.

The police booked Prabhu, of Trichy, on charges of stalking, criminal breach of trust, intending to insult the modesty of a woman and criminal intimidation on Thursday. Prabhu, already married, is a close relative of the woman, a college student in the city. The police said that he sent pictures of them together to her father on WhatsApp and Facebook.

Title: HC asks PSC to go ahead with selections, but bars it from declaring results
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

10 Jan 2005 --- Gavel at board meeting --- Image by © Bruno Ehrs/Corbis

Bhopal/Jabalpur: A division bench of MP High Court on Friday allowed the MP Public Service Commission (MPPSC) to continue with the process of selection and recruitment of candidates, stating the final result would be subject to court’s order on petitions challenging hike in OBC quota to 27% from 14%.

A day after the same bench asked MPPSC to retain OBC quota at 14% for recruitment of 400 posts of civil servants in place of 27% as provided in the amended Act on provision of OBC quota in the state, advocate general, Shahashank Shekhar, had filed an application before the court seeking modification in its order in response to petitions challenging 27% reservation for OBCs in medical college admissions passed on March 19, 2019, through which the court had stayed 13% hike in reservation for OBCs, thereby taking the OBC quota to 27%.

It was based on this interim order that civil service aspirants had sought a similar order for MPPSC exams, which the court allowed.

Shekhar, however, in his application on Wednesday had contended that the petitioners in the case have challenged the validity of the amendment Act 2019 by which reservation to the OBC category has been increased from 14% to 27% and the court’s interim order was contrary to settled principle of law that operation of a piece of legislation during pendency of challenge to its validity can’t be stayed but can only be set aside and declared ultra vires.

He had urged the court to allow the application and modify the interim order of March 19, 2019 “in the interest of justice”.

Hearing the application on Friday, the division bench of Chief Justice A K Mittal and Justice V K Shukla didn’t modify its previous order as prayed by the state government, but passed another order allowing the PSC to proceed with recruitment process subject to condition that final selection list would only be declared after the court order on petitions challenging 27 % reservation for OBCs in place of 14 % as existed earlier.

In their brief order, the judges said “Counsel for the petitioners didn’t have any objection to the continuation of the selection process, but urged that it should be subject to final outcome in the writ petition and no final list be published without the prior permission of this court. Accordingly, it is directed that it shall be open for the PSC to go ahead with the selection process. However, the same will not be finalized and no appointments shall be made without the prior permission of the high court”.

Title: Gujarat: Man’s shoulder dislocated 30 times fixed with 3D surgery
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Doctors at GMERS Hospital in Gotri perform the complex surgery

VADODARA: A dislocated shoulder proved to be a real pain for 24-year-old Arjun Mali, who not only had to endure physical discomfort, but also had to lose his job owing to the recurring problem.

In the last seven years, Mali had to face shoulder dislocation at least 30 times.

However, that is history after Mali underwent a complex surgery at GMERS Hospital at Gotri to fix his problem.
