Title: City to get a public garden bigger than Central Park
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Jaipur: The residents of Jaipur will soon have another public garden, 10 acres larger than the present Central Park. The park will come up on the 52.42 acre land in the middle of VT Road and Aravali Marg, constructed under the Mansarovar scheme by Rajasthan Housing Board.

This new park has been named as ‘City Park’ and CM Ashok Gehlot has already given his assent for the project.

The work orders will be issued soon. Central park is constructed on 42 acre land but the new ‘City Park’ will be bigger in area and will have more facilities for the residents.

Commissioner Rajasthan Housing Board Pawan Arora said that they are targeting to have green cover in major portion of the park. “We have planned to develop this park based on public gardens in developed countries. We want citizens to have a personal experience when they visit the park.

This will not just be a park for morning exercises, but there would be recreational facilities and interactive features for the people. There will be a children’s park, a food court, juice centre and other facilities. Almost 90% of the park area will have green cover,” said Arora.

He further said that the plantation for the park will begin this monsoon but other construction will take some time.

“The area is identified and map is finalized. Once the DPR is prepared, tenders will be invited. It will take a year-and-a-half to complete the construction, but the plantation in the park has to be started this monsoon,” Arora added.

As per the map provided by the officials, there will be six entrance gates, five parking lots, a three-km track, national flag post, butterfly garden, haat bazaar, a lake, a pond, an open air theatre, carnival house, an outdoor gym and other facilities. There has been a confusion for a long time about the type of construction at VT Road, which has now been resolved.

Title: Madurai: Chinese artist catches jallikattu on canvas
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

A painting by Zhang Yuwei on jallikattu

MADURAI: Chinese artist Zhang Yuwei, who has captured the spirit of bull tamers with brush strokes of water colour, wishes to exhibit his illustrations of the traditional Tamil sport jallikattu to the world. Madurai Kamaraj University (MKU) is set to display 22 of his paintings permanently on its campus.

Yuwei has drawn around 30 jallikattu paintings. In January, we had invited him for an international Tamil conference organized here.

During the event, 22 of his paintings were exhibited at the university and was inaugurated by the university vice chancellor M Krishnan,” said B Sathyamoorthy, head, department of Tamilology at MKU.

“As an illustrator, I always choose themes, which are directly related to my personal artistic experience and life. I felt jallikattu’s stories are particularly suitable for illustrations and I like to choose unique themes as inspiration. I believe it is fate and destiny that I got to do these paintings and I couldn’t be happier,” said Yuwei, who is also the national curator of Watercolour Illustration Association, China.

Yuwei first came to know of Tamil Nadu and jallikattu through his colleague and friend Neelakandan, an assistant professor at Shaoguan University, who is from Madurai. “Yuwei came for my wedding in 2018, travelling for the first time to Madurai with his family. I told him about jallikattu then and he was very intrigued to witness it. This year, he came for a second trip,” said Neelakandan.

“When I first learned about it, I was overwhelmed by the bravery, excitement, speed, and strength. I did not expect that there could be such a sport in the world that could directly hit the human heart. The colours are beautiful. A thrilling display of handsome warriors and wild cattle, almost characterizing our origins,” said Yuwei, reminiscing. He also mused upon Indian and Chinese cultures, explaining the common pursuit in art.

“When it comes to countries and cultures, I think they are different only in race, colour, and language. The pursuit is the same. As long as it is beautiful, everyone in the world should know about it (jallikattu) and they should like it. China and India are both ancient civilizations with a long history. I want to express and convey my knowledge of the world through my art, and tell a story to affect more young people,” observed the artist.

Yuwei has already taken his jallikattu works to China, where he was also honoured with a national award for the paintings. He also presented a watercolour illustration exhibition about jallikattu at Bournemouth University, England.

Title: Nirbhaya rape case: Debate delaying tactics of convicts, says Union minister G Kishan Reddy
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

G Kishan Reddy

Title: Rajasthan: ‘Mukti Caravan’ to raise awareness on child rights
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

DGP Bhupendra Singh flags off the ‘Mukti Caravan’ at Albert Hall on Friday.

JAIPUR: Rajasthan Director General of Police Bhupendra Singh on Friday flagged off ‘ Mukti Caravan ’, organised jointly by the state police and Kailash Satyarthi Children’s Foundation, to raise awareness about social evils such as child abuse, child labour and child trafficking.

The ‘Mukti Caravan’ will travel across the state in the next three months to raise public awareness about child rights .

The initiative is part of a nationwide campaign that will go from village to village across India raising awareness about such social evils.

During the event here, the DGP said that NGOs have an important role to play in the work.

He also spoke about action being taken against child labour and child abuse in the state.

On the occasion, Additional Director General of Police B L Soni, Rajiv Sharma, Ravi Meharda and Hemant Priyadarshi also expressed their views. Activists of the Bachpan Bachao Andolan also performed short plays related to child rights. PTI

Title: Co-op banks to provide Rs 500cr loans for agro facilities in state
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Jaipur: Two co-operative lenders will provide loans of Rs 500 crore for the establishment of agri-processing, warehouse and cold storage units in the state. Cooperative minister Udailal Anjana said on Friday that the department of co-operatives has released a plan to provide loans to agri-processing, warehouse, cold storage units to promote agro-processing, agribusiness and agri-exports.

A scheme of financing from Apex Bank and Central Cooperative Banks has been implemented for setting up these units. Under this, loans of Rs 500 crore will be made available to farmers and entrepreneurs setting up units.

He said that a scheme in this regard has been issued by the department of cooperatives. He said that the intention of chief minister Ashok Gehlot is to ensure that farmers' income is doubled and they get full value of their products. Keeping this in mind, this initiative has been taken. Under this, new and currently established agro-processing and agribusiness enterprises that are adopting modernisation, expansion or diversification will be financed by cooperative banks.

Principal Secretary of Cooperative Department Naresh Pal Gangwar said that loans of up to 75 per cent will be given for setting up units by cooperative banks at the interest rate of 10 per cent. He said government will provide 6 per cent subsidy with a maximum limit of Rs 1 crore for five years to farmers or a group of farmers for setting up such units. PTI

Title: Preparations on for practical examinations of Classes X-XII
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Preparations are under way for the practical examinations to be held in February for students of Classes X, XI and XII in Madurai , said district education department officials on Friday.

A meeting was held by the chief education officer R Swaminathan on Wednesday, during which external examiners for the practical exams were appointed and briefed about the processes and their duties. A total of 206 centres have been allotted in the district for the exams and the respective centres will be organizing the equipment and supplies required for the exams.

According to officials, the practical exams for Class XII are from February 3- 13, while for Class XI, it is from February 14-25. For Class X students, practical exams will be only after February 25.

Education department officials have also issued instructions regarding submission and uploading of marks to the examiners and centres. The external examiners conducting practical exams for Class XII and Class XI students are expected to submit the final marks lists to a pre-allotted common centre designated for the particular revenue district by February 14 and February 24 respectively.

Following the now digitized process, internal marks are to be uploaded to the directorate of government examinations website through an online portal on February 27, and a hard copy of the same has to be submitted to the district CEO office the next day.

“Practical exams are always known to be easier to clear and help boost the final score, which is especially crucial for Class XII students. We are holding sessions during school hours for students to practice and study,” said Perumal N, a higher secondary school teacher.

Title: TET exemption sought for teachers in non-minority schools
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: The Tamil Nadu Government-Aided Non-Minority School Teachers’ Association has sought exemption from Teachers Eligibility Test (TET) for 1,500 teachers in non-minority government-aided schools .

A request in this regard was submitted to school education state commissioner Thomas Vaidhyan on Friday. They have also requested for a 10-day refresher course to be held for the teachers in May for teachers in minority government-aided schools.

In a press release the association pointed to a recent announcement by school education minister in October 2019, that teachers who are serving without passing TET would be protected and a 10-day refresher training will be held.

Title: Now, Mundhe wants garden upright
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Nagpur: After cement roads and encroachments, municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe has started to concentrate on gardens. Mundhe directed the Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) officials to ensure cleanliness and proper recreation facilities at the gardens.

Mundhe took a review meeting on gardens’ operation and maintenance and directed the NMC officials to display boards highlighting the names of officials and agencies responsible for maintenance of the gardens. “Gardens are meant for gaining health by means of walking and fitness. Also, gardens are an ideal place to rest after a hectic schedule. Therefore, gardens should be well maintained. Happiness should prevail in gardens,” he said.

The NMC runs 126 gardens across the city. The NMC maintains 13 gardens on its own and the remaining 113 are maintained through private agencies.

After taking a review of the cement road projects, Mundhe had a served show cause notice to the contractor and officials. Mundhe issued instructions for proper parking at the NMC head office and launched a drive to take action against unauthorized vegetable markets and vendors selling vegetables and fruits outside designated market places.

Title: No leads yet in cab driver’s murder
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Jaipur: Mystery still shrouds the murder of cab driver whose body was found in Kotputli on NH-8 on Thursday morning. His vehicle too has not been found. At present the police have no leads on the motive behind the murder as well as on any suspects.

The deceased was identified as 32-year-old Raju Jatav who hailed from Nangli Ojha village in Alwar district.

“We are looking for his stolen vehicle but till now have not spotted it on the CCTV cameras. As of now there are no fresh leads to give us any suspects. We will question his family as well to see if they could point us in any direction,” said a police official.

Jatav’s family was looking for him since Wednesday night as he had called them when he was returning after dropping the passengers at Nagaur and had told them that he was heading home. However he did not make it back. On Thursday morning, the locals informed the police about a body lying close to the national highway.

He was strangled with a rope and dumped very close to the highway with no efforts made to hide his body, claimed police.

Title: Delhi assembly elections 2020: EC reviews poll readiness, CEO visits Shaheen Bagh
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Election Commission of India (Photo: PTI)

NEW DELHI: The Election Commission of India (ECI) will depute additional security at 19 polling stations in Shaheen Bagh where anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protesters have been sitting on a dharna for more than 45 days now.

Complete coverage on Delhi elections

Officials said that chief electoral officer (CEO) of Delhi Ranbir Singh and a team of election and police officials visited Shaheen Bagh on Friday, to assess the law and order situation ahead of a crucial review meeting on poll preparedness. Officials said the delegation found the situation “conducive” to conduct the polls on February 8.

“The delegation was keen to see whether there was proper access for voters to reach the polling booths since a portion of the area had been closed by the protesters. The officials found that the roads to the polling booths were not closed and the voters could easily cast their votes. Alternative routes were also identified if there was a problem later,” said an official, requesting anonymity.

Another official said there were 20 locations across the capital where anti-CAA protests had been under way, but Shaheen Bagh was the only area where a road had been blocked. “The polling booths in Shaheen Bagh were included in vulnerable locations and additional security would be deployed,” he said.

Sources said the ECI held a detailed discussion on the situation at Shaheen Bagh on Friday during review meetings, which were attended by Delhi CEO, other election officials, top police and Delhi government officials and nodal officers of other agencies.

“It is of prime importance that elections were conducted in free, fair, peaceful, accessible, inclusive, participative manner. The ECI would be ready to handhold whenever required, but field level officers should take swift action wherever warranted to ensure fair, just, legal and impartial elections,” chief election commissioner Sunil Arora was quoted as saying at a press statement issued by the ECI. Arora also asked the administrative officers in border areas of Delhi to ensure that adequate law and order arrangements were made.

Title: Challenge to meet rising demand for sugar: Sharad Pawar
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Sharad Pawar

PUNE: Former Union agriculture minister Sharad Pawar on Friday said meeting the increasing demand for sugar and dealing with uncertainty in the sector were the key challenges the sugar industry was facing.

He was speaking at the second international conference and exhibition on sustainability — innovation and diversification in sugar and allied industry. He said the estimated demand for sugar in the country by 2025 would be around 30 to 33 million tonne. “Taking into consideration the national commitment to security and requirement of land for foodgrain , there are constraints to increase the area to grow sugar cane. Thus, the demand can be met only by increasing productivity per unit of land by increasing sugar recovery,” Pawar said.

He said the stagnant yield of the sugar cane per hectare was around 70 tonne, whereas the potential yield was over 250 tonne per hectare. The industry would have to bridge this gap. The average sugar recovery was stagnant at 10.5% and it could be improved to 11.5 to 12.%. The government would have to support the researchers for developing varieties with high yield and high sugar content, Pawar said.

Jose Orive, the executive director of International Sugar Organisation (ISO) said the world market would depend on how much more India was expected to export.

Title: Stepping stone: Uttar Pradesh government schools to introduce pre-primary classes
Content:
Representative image

LUCKNOW: If all goes well then government schools in Uttar Pradesh will now run pre-primary classes . At present, government schools begin from class I.Admissions are likely to begin from April this year and the basic education department is preparing a curriculum focussing on the learning outcome goals.The main reason behind the introduction of pre-primary classes in government schools is to help parents who are keen to enroll their children in pre-primary schools but cannot afford the high fees of private schools.The government has decided to convert 75,000 anganwadis to pre-primary schools in the first phase for the purpose.Children in the age group of 3 years will be admitted in pre-primary schools. At present, 5-year-old and above kids are admitted in class 1 of government schools. Children from economically weaker section go to anganwadis, a type of rural childcare centres set up by the government to combat malnutrition and stunting among children in the 3-6 agegroup.According to Rohit Tripathi, senior expert with Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan, there are 1.80 lakh anganwadis in the state. Since 75,000 of these anganwadis operate from the premises of primary schools, it has been decided to convert them into pre-primary schools, he added.Officials said women and child development department through the Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) will continue to provide nutrition to children taking admission into pre-primary, while the basic education department will focus on their learning.

Title: HC breather to officials, bizman in Jal Mahal case
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Jaipur: A single bench of Rajasthan High Court on Friday granted relief to RAS officer Hridesh Kumar, retired IAS officer Vinod Zutshi, the then managing director of RTDC Rakesh Saini and businessman Navratan Kothari in the case of leasing land near the Jal Mahal Lake.

The court while quashing the cognizance taken by the lower court upheld the process of allotment of land associated with the Jal Mahal Lake. The court had reserved the verdict on January 29 after the parties concluded their arguments in the case.

In the petitions on behalf of the applicants, it was said that the complainant in the case Bhagwat Gaur had filed a case alleging foul play in the tender process, while the High Court had cancelled the lease deed of the land itself.

After the trial was taken up by the lower court on the basis of the High Court's decision on September 9, 2011, the Supreme Court quashed the High Court order and considering land allocation process to be “correct”, reduced the 99-year lease to 30 years.

The bench of Justice SP Sharma was told that the allotment process of land was done with complete transparency and the firm of applicant Kothari was allotted the land as he was the highest bidder. Hearing the arguments of the parties, the single bench quashed the cognisance taken by the lower court.

The 100-acre disputed land worth around Rs 3000 crore initially belonged to the Jaipur Development Authority(JDA), Jaipur Municipal Corporation (JMC) and the Public Works Department (PWD) but was transferred to the Rajasthan Tourism Development Corporation (RTDC), which then leased it to Kothari’s M/s Jal Mahal Resorts Pvt Ltd in 2005.

Kothari issued a statement on Friday, saying, “I always had the belief that at the end truth prevails. I had to face lots of challenges while facing the court trials. Since Jal Mahal project is very close to my heart I will do my best to complete it as it is planned to augment the travel and tourism quotient of Jaipur.”

Title: Schools principals want to bust coronavirus myths
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Nagpur: School Headmasters Charitable Association (SHCA) is planning to create awareness among students about the deadly coronavirus, so that they do not fall for rumours floating on social media. The association is planning to approach the Indian Medical Association (IMA) for help with expert speakers, who can provide medically correct information to students.

Zafar Khan, president of SHCA, said “Due to social media, false news spreads fast and vulnerable young minds get influenced easily. Being academicians, we are against the spread of unscientific messages that have potential to create panic among citizens. Doctors are the only qualified people to speak about this issue hence we are thinking of an initiative to make kids aware of the same.”

The IMA, which has already done a couple of workshops with SHCA, is open to suggestions on how this can be taken forward. Dr Laxmi Shrikhande, chairperson of IMA’s Adolescent Health Committee, said, “The idea sounds good and we are definitely open to having such an interaction. We look forward to meeting the principals and understanding in what format we can take this forward.”

Dilip Bose, another senior academician and office bearer of SHCA, said multiple fake news about coronavirus are spreading fast and affecting kids. “What happens is that kids panic when they hear news like mass deaths happening due to the virus and that it spreads through such and such way. And in today’s generation, what they read or see on social media is considered true by default. Recently, a WhatsApp forward said drinking cold drinks causes cancer and many took it seriously. Such myths need to be busted and with coronavirus, we need to step up our efforts,” said Bose.

Though nothing is finalized yet, some SHCA officials are thinking that a ‘master trainer’ approach would be more feasible. The draft plan is to ask IMA to conduct a myth busting seminar on coronavirus and also talk about precautions to be taken.

Title: Delhi polls 2020: Where are 1,000 new schools, asks Amit Shah
Content:
Amit Shah at Pitampura

NEW DELHI: Union home minister Amit Shah on Friday asked Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal to publish an advertisement giving the addresses of the 1,000 new schools that the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) had promised before the last assembly elections in 2015.“You had said you would build 1,000 new schools. How many have been built? You tell me. Where are these? Kejriwal, you put out so many advertisements. Now publish an advertisement with the addresses of all these schools. If you fall short of money, BJP will send it to you,” Shah said at a nukkad sabha in Pitampura while campaigning for BJP’s Shakur Basti candidate, S C Vats.The former BJP president, who also addressed similar gatherings at Wazirpur, Kamla Nagar and Trinagar, focused on the issue of security superseding anything else in Delhi, and the country. “Only person who can keep Delhi and the country safe, undivided, is Narendra Modi. There are various developmental issues but the security of the nation is the most important. If the country is not safe, how will we work for development! These people didn’t even do development, and played with national security,” he alleged.Shah asked the crowd to vote for Vats and also to “call up 50 people each after this sabha. Ask every possible family member and friend to vote for the BJP candidate. Will you?” As the crowd said yes in unison, he asked if everyone would vote before 10.30am and press the lotus button. The crowd again responded affirmatively.The home minister alleged Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan and the opposition parties were speaking in the same tone. “After the surgical strike and air strikes on Pakistan, this appeasement group wanted proof. These people and the Pakistan PM have the same language. Article 370? Ram Mandir? CAA? Same tone! I don’t understand the relationship between Imran Khan, Rahul Gandhi and Kejriwal? If you know, write to me,” Shah said.Campaigning at Ashok Vihar Phase I for Wazirpur candidate Mahendra Nagpal, Shah said under the AAP government, Delhi had the dirtiest water in the country. “Bureau of Indian Standards surveyed 21 cities. Delhi’s water was found to be the foulest. When I say this, Kejriwal says I am insulting Delhi! I respect people here but you are not Delhi, Kejriwal.”The minister also alleged that the AAP government hadn’t fulfilled any of its 2015 promises. AAP didn’t respond to the allegations.

Title: Women farmers pin hopes on relief package in this year’s Union Budget
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

The women farmers have demanded that the Centre announce a minimum slab of support to farm widows (File photo)

PUNE: Women farmers across the country are hoping for a comprehensive relief and rehabilitation package in the Union Budget to be presented on Saturday.

Vidya More, a 38-year-old farm widow from Osmanabad district, said the women farmers had been putting across their demands for the last two years, but to no avail. “Why can’t they pay heed to our demands?” More asked at an event organized recently by Makaan, a Pune-based group.

The women farmers have demanded that the Centre announce a minimum slab of support to farm widows, allocate funds and reopen all pending cases, even those that were not investigated since 2010. According to them, only 20-50% of the farm suicides get official recognition and support.

While More’s husband committed suicide around eight years ago, the state government refused to recognize his death as a farm suicide as he had not taken an institutional loan, making her ineligible for the ex-gratia of Rs1 lakh. While More got the farm land transferred in her name, she failed to get the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-Kisan) payout of Rs6,000 a year, despite having all the documents.

Seema Kulkarni, a key functionary of Makaan, said, “We strongly recommend the government announce a package for women farmers from farm suicide-affected districts,” she said. “Whatever the Centre announces, the state can add to it and follow the best practices,” she added.

The suggestions included a uniform policy across states and all departments to address farm suicides that would include tenant farmers, women farmers, farmers with non-institutional debt, streamlining data put out by the national crime records bureau in urban and rural categories and comprehensive policy specifically with reference to women farmers from the farm suicide-affected areas. The women farmers also wanted at least Rs7 lakh compensation across all states. They stated the amount should be sanctioned and transferred into the woman’s account in a time-bound manner (within three months of the farmer’s death).

Title: 3 from Jaipur held in MP for posing as Nepal VP advisers
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Ujjain ( MP ): Three persons were arrested on Friday for allegedly posing as cultural advisers to the vice-president of Nepal and availing state guest facilities in Ujjain in Madhya Pradesh, police said.

Superintendent of police Sachin Atulkar identified the three as Mahavir Prasad, his son Kuldeep Prasad and brother Pramod Kumar, all residents of Jaipur.

“Acting on a tip-off, we arrested the three persons. They were living in Ujjain Circuit House posing as cultural advisers to the vice-president of Nepal. They had submitted fake letters to the collector and police for this,” Atulkar said.

He said the three enjoyed free stay, government vehicles and easy passage for prayer at Mahakaleshwar Temple, part of the hospitality provided as per protocol to such guests.

The SP said visiting cards, recommendation letters were seized from them, adding that main accused Mahavir Prasad had some 20 cases of cheating registered against his name in Rajasthan. PTI

Title: Ahmedabad: Three women stuff chili powder into woman’s private parts
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A 22-year-old sales executive from the Vadaj area of city on Friday filed an FIR at Vadaj police station, alleging that three women, including her former lover’s wife, stuffed chili powder into her private parts and assaulted her.

In her FIR, the woman stated that she worked for Girish Goswami — the husband of Janu Goswami — four years ago at a garments shop in Naranpura . During her stint there, the complainant and Girish fell in love.

The complainant and Girish had a relationship for two years after which the complainant broke it off and started working at a garments store in Vastrapur.

Two months ago, Girish called the complainant and they got talking to each other again. One month ago, Janu learned that they had patched things up and she called and threatened the complainant, the FIR states.

At around 9.45am on Thursday, when the complainant was walking to Pragatinagar from her house in Vadaj, Janu and her friend Rinka Goswami drove up on a scooter and forced her to on the vehicle between them, the FIR adds.

They took her to Janu’s place, where another friend of theirs, Thakuri Goswami, was present.

“They locked me in a room and Thakuri told Janu and Rinka to disrobe me and stuff chili powder in my private parts. Which they did. While I was screaming in pain, they shot a video on a mobile phone,” the complainant stated in the FIR.

Janu then told the complainant to pay her Rs 50 lakh, alleging that Girish had spent that sum on clothes for the complainant. Janu also threatened to throw acid on complainant’s face if she ever met Girish again, the FIR states. They later released her and she went home.

Inspector J A Rathwa of Vadaj police station said all three accused women were arrested and charged with abduction, causing hurt and criminal intimidation.

Title: Lucknow woman under coronavirus scanner
Content:
Representative image

LUCKNOW: A 58-year-old woman from Gomtinagar has been put under observation for a possible exposure to the deadly coronavirus , which has turned into an epidemic in China and has grown into a global health emergency.The woman had returned to Lucknow from Shanghai on January 25 after which the district health team was put on the task to confirm the virus’ presence in the woman’s body.While the confirmatory report for coronavirus is still awaited, the woman has been quarantined at her house. According to chief medical officer (CMO), Lucknow, Dr Narendra Agarwal, the woman’s blood sample was collected after a letter was received from the state health department.“We received a letter form the state unit around four to five days back directing us to collect the woman’s blood sample. A team of doctors was sent to her house, which examined all the symptoms for the virus. Her blood sample has been sent to state laboratory and instructions have been given to her to stay at home. Additionally, a medical team has also been deployed at her home to deal with any emergency,” said Dr Agarwal.“We are awaiting her sample report and as of now she is only a suspected case,” he added.

Title: Delhi elections 2020: No development, only broken roads in illegal colonies, says Hardeep Singh Puri
Content:
Hardeep Singh Puri at Shiv Vihar

NEW DELHI: “Forget about winning Delhi. You (Kejriwal) better concentrate on saving the New Delhi seat,” Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri said on Friday as he launched into a tirade against chief minister Arvind Kejriwal over his “false” claims.The minister said that Kejriwal claimed to have spent Rs 8,000 crore on development of roads, drainage and sewer lines. “But I cannot see any improvement during my visits to the unauthorised colonies. Only broken roads are there, which generate dust and add to the city’s high-pollution level. It is important to check the claims of the government,” Puri said while addressing a public meeting in Shiv Vihar, which falls under Mustafabad constituency.The nukkad sabha was held without an elaborate function, and the minister had reached the venue as per the schedule at sharp 4 pm. Seated on a desk, when Puri spoke for about 15 minutes, the local residents, mostly youths, listened to him in rapt attention.“The Centre conferred ownership rights on more than 40 lakh people living in 1,731 unauthorised colonies of Delhi. Under Jahan jhuggi, wahin makan scheme, two- room-set houses are being allotted to slum dwellers. We have done re-development of Kathputli Colony and residents are expected to get allotment in a week or two. Had the green tribunal not raised an objection, we would have allotted three out of the seven towers by December 31, 2019 itself,” claimed Puri.Attacking AAP government over polluted water supply in Delhi, Puri said that Kejriwal was covering up the issue by delivering a ‘physics lecture’.The minister also accused Kejriwal of depriving residents from availing benefits of Ayushman Bharat scheme. “In case of serious diseases, people would prefer good treatment at hospitals rather than visiting mohalla clinics, which lack facilities and staff,” he claimed.“Kejriwal government delayed Metro Phase-IV work and failed to engage 500 new DTC buses in Delhi in five years,” alleged Puri adding that Mustafabad is still not on the DTC route.“Like this area, other parts of Delhi are also facing an acute shortage of public transport. Only 3,000 DTC buses against the required number of 11,000 vehicles are plying on roads. In past four years, no new bus has been added in the cluster,” the minister claimed.“Delhi will get 11,000 buses within six months if BJP wins election. Mustafabad will also get buses for various routes,” he said to a round of applause from the audience.

Title: Kids thrashed: Panel to file report by February 3
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Jaipur: A four-member committee formed to probe the alleged thrashing of children by policemen at a juvenile home here will file its report by February 3, the Child Protection Commission said on Thursday.

On January 17, police were informed about an altercation between security guards and children at the juvenile home in Transport Nagar area, following which policemen reached the home and severely beat up the children, Child Protection Commission Chairman Sangita Beniwal said.

She alleged that the policemen had entered the home without marking their presence in the entry register which is not allowed as per the norms. The commission subsequently formed the panel on January 19 to look into the incident. Further action will be recommended to the state government after the committee submits its report, Beniwal said. Transport Nagar SHO Gyasuddin, however, denied the allegations, saying police only spoke to children at the home. He added two security guards of the juvenile home were attacked by children and police found them with injuries. PTI

Title: Class X girl from Dholpur commits suicide in Jaipur
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: A 16-year-old girl, who was student of Class X, committed suicide by hanging herself from the ceiling in city’s Mahesh Nagar on Friday morning. The reason for the suicide is yet to be confirmed as no suicide note was found. She stayed here along with her brothers, while her parents stayed in a village in Dholpur.

The deceased has been identified as Kavita Gujjar.

Bala Ram, SHO, Mahesh Nagar police station, said, “On Friday morning, Kavita told her younger brother that she will not go to school and did not give any reason for not going. Her brother said that he will complain to their uncle who lived close by. He went to the washroom and when he came out after 15 minutes, he saw the girl hanging.”

At the time of incident, the girl was alone at home with her younger brother while the eldest sibling had gone to their village in Dholpur for his mother’s surgery.

“The reason for the suicide is still not clear and it could be due to academic pressure or possibly she got agitated when her younger sibling questioned her about not going to school. We checked everywhere but found no suicide note. The family could not shed any light as to why she took her own life. We will question them further to see if we can find any reason,” added the official.

The girl’s post-mortem was done and the body handed over to the family.

This comes just a day after a 16-year-old girl allegedly jumped to death from terrace of her apartment in Udaipur on Thursday evening.

The girl Shodashi Patel, daughter of Milind Patel, was a student of DPS School here who was also enrolled in a coaching institute in Kota for medical entrance. She had come home few days back for some examination.

Title: Fasting for 47 days, woman seer picked from Matri Sadan
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Haridwar: In a high-voltage drama that unfolded at Matri Sadan on Thursday night, woman seer Padmavati, who had been on an indefinite fast for the cause of ‘Clean Ganga’ for over 40 days, was lifted forcibly by the police and admitted to Doon medical college hospital amid tight security. The seer refused to take any medical treatment at the hospital and all her vitals were reported to be normal. Thereafter, she was sent back to Matri Sadan late on Friday and she reached the ashram safely.

Another Ganga crusader and Matri Sadan seer Aatmabodhanand sat on hunger strike beginning on Friday in her place. Aatmabodhanand had earlier last year concluded his 194-day-long hunger strike on May 4 after getting assurance from the National Mission for Clean Ganga director that all the demands of professor GD Agrawal would be met.

Padmavati who had reportedly been fasting for 47 days looked stable while she was being taken into an ambulance. The seer refused a stretcher or wheelchair and walked till the ambulance. “I urge all Indians to help me get justice. I am absolutely fit. I will also be killed like professor GD Agrawal. The state administration is after my life,” Padmavati alleged while she was being taken in the ambulance.

“The act of lifting a woman seer from her tapasya at night is violation of the Supreme Court order which prohibits police from picking up a woman post sunset or before sunrise. A case has been registered by us at Haridwar CJM’s court on Friday. Padmavati is fit. She didn’t cause damage to anyone and was peacefully sitting on a protest inside Matri Sadan, when she was forcibly lifted by police,” said Matri Sadan seer Brahamachari Dayanand.

“It was not an arrest, the seer was shifted. It was a combined operation by the district administration, chief medical officer’s team and police. The seer’s reports stated that she needed medical attention else it could be life threatening for her. To save her, we had moved the seer from Matri Sadan to the hospital. After getting district magistrate’s order as per protocol, the seer was taken to the hospital for medical attention in the presence of the entire team,” said Haridwar SSP S Senthil Avoodai Krishnaraj.

Dr KK Tamta, medical superintendent of Doon hospital, said, “Her vitals are stable. She refused to take drip or any kind of treatment and also refused to give blood sample for tests. Though her urine test report is normal, ketones are negative, so the physician who was seeing her has recommended her discharge.” On January 25, seers of Matri Sadan had expressed apprehension of a conspiracy by the state government to end the ongoing fast-unto-death by its woman seer Padmavati by using force and a possible attempt to kill her as well as the ashram chief Swami Shivanad Saraswati. In an application given to Haridwar chief judicial magistrate under CRPC’s section 39 clause 5, (which gives the public right to give information of certain offences), Brahmachari Dayanand of Matri Sadan claimed that two of its earlier seers — professor GD Agrawal and Swami Nigamanand — were “killed” in similar manners.

Title: No respite from shivering cold in Rajasthan, Fatehpur registers 1.6 degree Celsius
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

People in Jaipur woke up to another chilly morning as a minimum temperature of 8.1 degree Celsius was recorded... Read More

JAIPUR: There was no respite from shivering cold for the third consecutive day on Friday when majority of the places witnessed its temperatures below the normal notch. Fatehpur ( Sikar ) remained coldest in the state where a minimum temperature of 1.6 degree Celsius was recorded, the Met reports said.

Attributing the continued dip in the mercury to the active northerly winds and vanishing of factors like western disturbances and upper air cyclonic circulation, Jaipur Meteorological office said that minor respite from the shivering cold would be witnessed in the coming days.

People in Jaipur woke up to another chilly morning as a minimum temperature of 8.1 degree Celsius was recorded in the city. In the past three days, Jaipur had witnessed a dip of almost 4 degree Celsius in its minimum temperatures. Due to the revival of the cold wave in past three days, the roads witnessed an empty look during early morning and late evening hours. People were confined to their homes while the footfall at city’s parks was also been affected. Since no fog and mist were witnessed in and around the city, the air, road and rail traffic from Jaipur were smooth.

Many places witnessed its minimum temperatures below 5 degree Celsius which affected normal life. Mild fog in the morning in the districts including Sikar, Churu, Sriganganagar and Bikaner also affected the road traffic on the national and state highways connecting these districts.

Fatehpur (Sikar) was followed by Sikar where a minimum temperature of 2.5 degree Celsius was recorded, Sriganganagar 5 degree Celsius , Churu 5.2 degree Celsius, Pilani 5.9 degree Celsius, Udaipur 6.2 degree Celsius, Kota and Bikaner 7.8 degree Celsius each, Ajmer 8.3 degree Celsius and a minimum temperature of Jaisalmer 8.9 degree Celsius, Jodhpur 9.2 degree Celsius and a minimum temperature of 9.5 degree Celsius were recorded in Barmer .

Though majority of the places in the state witnessed its minimum temperatures below 10 degree Celsius, the Jaipur Met office said that due to the active western disturbances and upper air cyclonic circulation, the temperatures will start dipping from Sunday onwards. There is likely a rise of almost 4 degree Celsius in the minimum and maximum temperatures across the state in the next 48 hours.

Title: Delhi elections 2020: Vote for son of family for subsidies, says Arvind Kejriwal
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Arvind Kejriwal (left) at Chandni Chowk

NEW DELHI: Calling Delhi a “family of two crore people” of which he is the “elder son”, chief minister Arvind Kejriwal urged people to vote for AAP if they wanted the water-electricity subsidies to continue.

Complete coverage on Delhi elections

“BJP has come out with its manifesto and they have not promised free electricity. If you vote for BJP, you will have to pay these bills. Their manifesto also does not have free bus rides for women. Till Arvind Kejriwal is your chief minister, all these things will be free,” he said at Chandrawal in the Chandni Chowk constituency.

“Kejriwal is zero without you; nobody knew me five years ago. You have put me on this chair and I am like your elder son,” the AAP convener told the crowd. “For the first time in the history of Delhi, all these parties have come together with just one goal — defeat Kejriwal. (Uttar Pradesh CM) Yogiji will be here on Saturday. Instead of sorting out problems in their own states, they have come here to attacks us,” he added.

The chief minister said his parents had been deeply hurt by BJP calling him a terrorist. “I gave up everything to take part in the anti-corruption movement. Despite being diabetic, I sat on a hunger strike for 15 days. If you think I am a terrorist, don’t vote for us.”

Kejriwal promised that he would take a dip in the clean Yamuna in the next five years. AAP will also ensure a complete clean-up and beautification of Delhi, he claimed. “There are garbage dumps and open drains everywhere. We will force the corporations to work,” he said. The government will buy 11,000 buses and after deploying marshals, it will do so in all colonies and mohallas, he added.

Terming the education sector revival as unprecedented in India’s history, Kejriwal said, “No state has been able to ensure 96% results. When (BJP’s) Amit Shah attacks our schools, he attacks their hard work. Abuse me but don’t say anything about our kids, parents, teachers.”

Reacting to the manifesto comment, Delhi BJP president Manoj Tiwari said the existing free schemes would continue.

Title: ‘Run to Rann’ flagged off from Jaisalmer
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Jaisalmer: Adventure activity ‘Run to Rann’ was organised under the aegis of Battle Axe Division. A team of 11 individuals from the division participated in the event which commenced in Jaisalmer on January 16 this year. The team covered a distance of 1,860km from Jaisalmer to Koteshvar and back over a period of 11 days. Along the course of the expedition, the team carried out activities in various phases, which included cycling, relay run and camel safari. Major General Rakesh Kapoor, general officer commanding, battle axe division flagged off the expedition on January 30 from Jaisalmer.

The team comprising of one officer, two junior commissioned officers and eight soldiers were trained at Jaisalmer Military Station which helped them cover the long journey with enthusiasm and zeal.

The aim of the expedition was to inculcate the spirit of adventure, physical fitness, self-confidence and esprit-de-corps among the troop members.

Title: DG vigilance Hitesh Awasthy made interim UP Police chief
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Hitesh Chandra Awasthi (right) took charge as the interim UP DGP from OP Singh who retired from service on Fri... Read More

LUCKNOW: Uttar Pradesh government on Friday appointed 1985 batch IPS officer Hitesh Chandra Awasthy as the interim Director General of Police. While at the helm, he will continue to be director-general, vigilance, till further orders. Awasthy was given additional charge of heading the UP Police after DGP O P Singh retired on Friday.

Talking to reporters, Awasthy said, smart policing on lines of ministry of home affairs will be implemented across the state. “Beat system forms the backbone of a policing and will be our focus area and the efforts of former DGP OP Singh will be carried forward. Also, policemen’s behavior with commoners should improve,” he said.

Awasthy also told newsmen that an elaborate strategy to curb crime against women and children will be hammered out and traffic indiscipline will be checked with Integrated Traffic Management System (ITMS). The police chief also said cybercrime will be effectively dealt with forensic science.

Awasthy had a 12-year stint with Central Bureau of Investigation during which he was also posted as joint-director Delhi unit and handled the 2G scam. He has also had a memorable stint with NCRB and was SP, Haridwar in 1991-94 during undivided UP.

Title: No respite from shivering cold in Rajasthan, Fatehpur registers 1.6 degree Celsius
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

People in Jaipur woke up to another chilly morning as a minimum temperature of 8.1 degree Celsius was recorded... Read More

JAIPUR: There was no respite from shivering cold for the third consecutive day on Friday when majority of the places witnessed its temperatures below the normal notch. Fatehpur ( Sikar ) remained coldest in the state where a minimum temperature of 1.6 degree Celsius was recorded, the Met reports said.

Attributing the continued dip in the mercury to the active northerly winds and vanishing of factors like western disturbances and upper air cyclonic circulation, Jaipur Meteorological office said that minor respite from the shivering cold would be witnessed in the coming days.

People in Jaipur woke up to another chilly morning as a minimum temperature of 8.1 degree Celsius was recorded in the city. In the past three days, Jaipur had witnessed a dip of almost 4 degree Celsius in its minimum temperatures. Due to the revival of the cold wave in past three days, the roads witnessed an empty look during early morning and late evening hours. People were confined to their homes while the footfall at city’s parks was also been affected. Since no fog and mist were witnessed in and around the city, the air, road and rail traffic from Jaipur were smooth.

Many places witnessed its minimum temperatures below 5 degree Celsius which affected normal life. Mild fog in the morning in the districts including Sikar, Churu, Sriganganagar and Bikaner also affected the road traffic on the national and state highways connecting these districts.

Fatehpur (Sikar) was followed by Sikar where a minimum temperature of 2.5 degree Celsius was recorded, Sriganganagar 5 degree Celsius , Churu 5.2 degree Celsius, Pilani 5.9 degree Celsius, Udaipur 6.2 degree Celsius, Kota and Bikaner 7.8 degree Celsius each, Ajmer 8.3 degree Celsius and a minimum temperature of Jaisalmer 8.9 degree Celsius, Jodhpur 9.2 degree Celsius and a minimum temperature of 9.5 degree Celsius were recorded in Barmer .

Though majority of the places in the state witnessed its minimum temperatures below 10 degree Celsius, the Jaipur Met office said that due to the active western disturbances and upper air cyclonic circulation, the temperatures will start dipping from Sunday onwards. There is likely a rise of almost 4 degree Celsius in the minimum and maximum temperatures across the state in the next 48 hours.

Title: Two killed in cave-in near Motera stadium
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Spot where accident took place

AHMEDABAD: Two construction labourers , who had no safety gear, got buried and died on Friday afternoon while laying the drainage line for AMC near Motera cricket stadium. Ahead of the inauguration of the world-class cricket stadium, the AMC has begun rushed development of basic amenities around it, and preliminary investigation by police suggests work safety protocol was not followed.

When questioned about the negligence, DCP Zone-2, Dharmendra Shrama said that he was unaware of all facts and just knew that two labourers had died at the AMC’s drainage line construction work.

The two construction labourers who died were Pravin Kumar, 27, and Gautak Kumar, 45. Both stayed near Motera and hail from Rajasthan, said inspector B K Gamar of Chandkheda police.

“The work of laying drainage line was going on between Asaram Ashram crossroads and Sardar Patel stadium where a JCB machine was being used to dig out the soil,” said Gamar.

He said the pipes were being laid at a depth of nearly 10 feet. The labourers fell in the pit and a pile of mud fell on them.

An official of Ahmedabad Fire and Emergency Services (AFES) said that the incident took place at around 3.15pm. “It took around half an hour to dig them out and then they were taken to a nearby hospital by ambulance,” said the official.

Gamar said that the two were declared brought dead at the hospital after which a case of accidental death was registered.

Title: AAP says BJP anti-migrant after it calls Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal outsider
Content:
Harsh Vardhan

NEW DELHI: AAP on Friday called BJP an “anti-migrant” party after Union minister Harsh Vardhan called Arvind Kejriwal an “outsider”.Recently, during an election campaign, Kejriwal called himself the son of Delhi, which led to Vardhan’s reaction, who claimed that Kejriwal was from Haryana and was ‘not the son of Delhi’. The Union minister questioned how Kejriwal, who was born in Hisar and settled in Kaushambi in Ghaziabad, could be a son of Delhi.Following this, Kejriwal hit out at Vardhan for calling him an “outsider”. He took to Twitter to claim that people from Uttar Pradesh and Haryana who have settled in Delhi may be outsiders for BJP, but the city has “adopted” them and they are part of the Delhi family. “Doctor Sahib, you hate me. You can abuse me. How can you call everyone born in UP and Haryana and settled in Delhi outsiders?” Kejriwal tweeted.Meanwhile, at a press conference, Rajya Sabha member Sanjay Singh said, with the anti-migrant mindset, BJP was insulting the people of Haryana, UP and Bihar who live and work in Delhi and contribute to the economy of the state.Singh asked Vardhan whether Kejriwal, who is from Haryana, lives in Ghaziabad and has worked hard for the people of Delhi in the past five years, didn’t deserve to be called Delhi’s son. The AAP leader urged the migrants who have come from Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and Haryana to carefully note Vardhan’s statement.Singh said BJP never stood up for the migrants when they were attacked in different parts of the country, including Gujarat.Singh added that the BJP minister’s remarks amounted to an insult to the people of UP, Bihar, Haryana who have settled in the capital. “Arvind Kejriwal is Delhi’s son and has fulfilled all his duties like a son would. People of Delhi are not going to be misled by these cruel and insulting statements by you,” Singh said.

Title: Lucknow: ‘Spread happiness & love to serve society’
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

LUCKNOW: Exhorting students to spread happiness , Brahmakumari Shivani on Friday said at a time when the world is going through a tumultuous phase, people should contribute in a positive manner by staying happy and sharing love.

Speaking at a session, ‘Call of Time’, at a private school in Gomtinagar , she said the best way one could serve the society was by bringing about a change in oneself and one’s thought process.

“Thought of a person speaks a lot about him. If someone complains about something, his internal power slows down, while if someone appreciates, internal power automatically increases. We should pay attention to our thoughts,” said Shivani,

“A person’s behaviour indirectly affects environment. Therefore, one should take oath to spreads happiness and love which is the need of the hour,” she said.

Title: Kolkata: Leisure hub at old port workshop
Content:
Indentured Indian Labourers’ Memorial

KOLKATA: A disused workshop on 32 acres and nearly 600 metres of riverfront in Kidderpore will be turned into a leisure zone by Kolkata port authority under Phase-I of a project to put surplus land in the city for sustainable use.The land is next to the old clock tower of Kolkata Port Trust that has now been renamed as Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port Trust ( SPMPT ) and the Indenture Memorial, from where thousands of indentured labourers had left the country to form the Indian diaspora.“We have engaged experts to prepare a final report. There will be private investment. We will only facilitate them by creating infrastructure like jetties. The heritage clock tower and Indenture Museum are attractions for people. Our aim is to develop a river cruise terminal by repairing the existing jetty at the Indenture Memorial. There are also some old Tea Transit (TT) sheds that we will revamp to create space for private operators to set up restaurants, amusement parks or other attractions. Plots will be let out on lease,” said Vinit Kumar, chairman, SPMPT.According to Kumar, there can be an amphitheatre along with gardens and fountains to attract both city residents and tourists. The idea is to throw open the city’s riverfront to all, ensuring them leisure and entertainment in a safe environment.“The location is also close to the heart of the city. People can move through Hastings and then cross the swing-bridge to reach the spot. There is also tremendous potential for cruise tourism along the river. Cruises are already operating from Kolkata to Varanasi and Dhaka. We can also have proper cruises to the Sundarbans,” Kumar added.The Kolkata port owns large plots in the city, Haldia, Howrah and other districts. The ministry of shipping is now keen to utilise all port lands that have not been used for operational purposes. There are two reasons for this. One is to earn revenue and the other is to prevent encroachment. SPMPT will also use its land in Balagarh, Hooghly for cargo evacuation. Plots in Haldia have also been offered for commercial use.Satinder Pal Singh, joint secretary, ministry of shipping, said efforts are on to promote coastal tourism and link rivers to the sea. “The ministry of shipping wants to use surplus land profitably by setting up townships, clusters and industrial hubs,” Singh added. While port land is already being let out for townships in Mumbai, a detailed plan for Kolkata is awaited.

Title: Pakistan's interference in election won’t be tolerated: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal
Content:
Arvind Kejriwal

नरेंद्र मोदी जी भारत के प्रधानमंत्री है। मेरे भी प्रधानमंत्री है। दिल्ली का चुनाव भारत का आंतरिक मसला है और हमें आ… https://t.co/IvE9QPUZ91 — Arvind Kejriwal (@ArvindKejriwal) 1580457560000

People of India must defeat #Modimadness ,Under pressure to lose another State Elections(Delhi on Feb 8th),he resor… https://t.co/xYmgah8Eju — Ch Fawad Hussain (@fawadchaudhry) 1580354158000

NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday disparaged a Pakistan minister's calls to defeat Narendra Modi in the Delhi assembly elections , saying polls in the capital were an internal matter of India and any interference by “the biggest sponsor of terrorism” would not be tolerated.Complete coverage on Delhi elections“Narendra Modi is the Prime Minister of India. He is my PM also,” Kejriwal said on Twitter after Pakistan science and technology minister Fawad Hussain Chaudhry’s tweet started receiving vitriolic response. “The Delhi elections are an internal affair of the country and we cannot tolerate the interference of the biggest sponsor of terrorism. However hard Pakistan may try, it cannot attack the unity of the country.”Chaudhry had posted a tweet saying, “People of India must defeat #Modimadness. Under pressure to lose another State Elections (Delhi on Feb 8th), he resorts to ridiculous claims and threats endangering Region, Mr Modi has lost balance after internal and external reaction to Kashmir, Citizenship laws and failing economy (sic).”PM Imran Khan’s minister has always been a controversial politician, according to reports from Pakistan. Earlier this month, Mubahsar Luqman, a TV anchor, filed a police report against Chaudhry for slapping him at a wedding of a provincial minister’s son. He had similarly slapped journalist Sami Ibrahim at a wedding in June last yearThe mischievous tweet came at a time when references to Pakistan, Shaheen Bagh, and the ‘goli maro’ remarks of a minister have roiled the city’s political air. In such an atmosphere, allegations and counter-allegations are flying thick, and political parties are taking to issues and narratives normally not associated with assembly polls.Manoj Tiwari, Delhi BJP chief, said, “Pakistan’s support for Kejriwal, who is the supporter of the tukde-tukde gang, is a matter of concern. Should explain to the people of Delhi whether AAP is fighting the election with the support of Pakistan.”Citing the Pakistan minister’s remarks, BJP Model Town candidate Kapil Mishra asserted that the Delhi assembly elections had taken on a hue of a general election because “the enemies of the country have united”. Mishra was earlier banned by the Election Commission from campaigning for 48 hours for purportedly trying to aggravate differences between two communities through his Twitter remarks that the February 8 elections was a “muqabla” between India and Pakistan. He had followed it up with remarks that several “mini-Pakistans” had been created in Delhi, Shaheen Bagh being an example in this regard.BJP’s Hari Nagar candidate Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga added that by voting for the saffron party, Delhi’s people would in effect be carrying out another surgical strike against Pakistan.

Title: Centre has failed on development front: Ashok Gehlot
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Rajasthan chief minister Ashok Gehlot

Chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday said the Narendra Modi government at the Centre has failed on the development front. Citing a polling agency survey, Gehlot tweeted that people are upset due to inflation. “A latest survey shows people feel their living standards gone down, quality of life deteriorated since NDA govt came to power. There is much depression among common people as income is going down but expenditure is increasing," he said in his tweet.

Title: Rajasthan seeks help from Centre to fight locusts
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

This year, Rajasthan has faced one of its major locust attacks continuing since May 2019. (File photo)

JAIPUR: The state agriculture department is seeking Central government’s support to make adequate efforts to contain entry of locusts from May 2020. The department official has told that they will write a letter to the Union ministry of agriculture for human resource support, taking up the matter with the neighbouring countries, better coordination with the agencies like FAO and logistical support.

This year, Rajasthan has faced one of its major locust attacks continuing since May 2019. The locust attack generally happened from May till October but this year it has been active even in winters has surprised all concerned agencies and government offices. “The natural cycle of locust begins in May. Keeping this in mind, we would like start out preparations as early as possible. This is why, it has been decided to seek central government assistance in all possible manners,” said Om Prakash, commissioner of agriculture department.

The state and union government has been facing each other over the issue of locust. The latter has accused the state of laxity in providing all possible help to the farmers while the former has demanded centre’s attention in containing the situation. The department has also asked the union government to provide equipment like machines for spraying chemicals and better coordination with countries like Pakistan. This year, locust has affected close to 3.45 lakh hectares of land in 10 districts of Rajasthan.

Title: Builder gets 2-yr jail term for not meeting deadline
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Kolhapur: The Kolhapur district consumer redressal forum on Thursday sentenced a builder to two years simple imprisonment and imposed a fine of Rs 10,000 for failing to hand over three bungalows to two customers as per the agreement.

In addition, the forum has also asked the builder to pay compensation of Rs 50,000 to each of the two customers, who had filed the complaint.

Pushpanjali Amol Patil, a resident of Mahadik Colony, had approached the consumer forum in 2014 against builder Sunil Shamrao Tate, alleging that he had not completed the construction of two bungalows as per the agreement signed between them. Patil had booked two bungalows at Mauje Nerli in June 2013 and paid Rs five lakh to Tate.

In its order then, the consumer forum had ordered Tate to complete the construction, give occupancy certificate and other legal documents to Patil. However, Tate failed to carry out the order.

At the same time, another woman, Usha Kishor Shingare, lodged a similar complaint with the forum against Tate regarding non-delivery of one bungalow she had booked. The forum had issued similar orders to Tate in this case too. The forum had asked Tate to complete the formality within 30 days.

When Tate failed to comply with the consumer forum’s orders, the two filed fresh complaints against him for failing to execute the forum’s order under section 27 of Consumer Protection Act in January 2016. Combining the two complaints, the forum held Tate guilty in both the cases and ordered two years simple imprisonment. The forum also imposed a fine of Rs 10,000 on him.

BOX: 15k complaints addressed

Kolhapur district consumer redressal forum has addressed 15,467 of the 16,777 complaints it has received till date. Savita Bhosale, chairperson of the forum, said the forum is authorized to handle cases up from Rs 10 to Rs 25 lakh. She said the complainant is not needed to deploy a lawyer as per the provisions of Consumer Protection Act. Forum can handle criminal and civic recovery

Title: Cops to invoke MCOCA against Bishnoi gang
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Kolhapur: Three-members of Bishnoi gang , who were injured in the police encounter at Kini toll plaza will be booked under Maharashtra Control of Organized Crime Act ( MCOCA ) by the Kolhapur police.

District superintendent of police Abhinav Deshmukh said that he had sent a proposal recommending MCOCA against three-gang members to special inspector general (Kolhapur Range) Suhas Warke. The trio are likely to be sent to either city’s Kalamba or Pune’s Yerwada jail. The police further said that as many as 19 members of the gang are likely to face stringent MCOCA, police said.

Police sources said that the gang is facing as many as 48 serious cases like murder, extortion, kidnapping, and robbery in Rajasthan. Further investigations are being done to check if the gang had any connections with the Maharashtra underworld. “Preliminary investigation has revealed that Bishnoi had some connections with criminals and interests in running a gas agency and material shops in Nashik and Pune,” said a police source.

Shravankumari Bishoni, who was admitted to Chhatrapati Pramilaraje Hospital after the encounter, was discharged on Friday and will be produced before the court on Saturday. He had sustained bullet injuries to leg during the encounter. A team of Rajasthan police is camping in the city and coordinating with Kolhapur police for the investigation.

The trio have been identified as Shamlal Govardhanram Punia alias Bishnoi (24), Shravankumar Manoharlal Bishnoi (24) and Shriram Pancharam (24) (all from Jodhpur) were arrested by the police after the encounter. Shamlal, who is said to be a leader of the gang, sustained injuries and is admitted to hospital while Shriram, who was driving the car, is currently in police custody.

Title: Rajasthan expects Nirmala Sitharaman to provide relief to micro and small enterprises
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Nirmala Sitharaman

JAIPUR: At a time when the insecurity of job losses is rising, economy is showing no signs of revival and the industry, especially the micro and small enterprises , has scaled down operations in the absence of credit and demand, people have a long-list of expectations from the budget and the urgency is hard to miss. TOI spoke to cross sections of people in the state to understand what they expect from finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman , who will present the Union Budget on Saturday.

Job losses have become the most worrying concern. Many said they don’t know when they will be in the line of fire. “The reality of losing one’s job has become so immediate that every single bad news about the economy shakes your existence,” said Sameer Vyas, who works in the beleaguered telecom sector. Sameer’s fear is not misplaced given the hard times the employers are negotiating to keep themselves floating. “When big companies announce job cuts, they grab headlines. But thousands of micro and small entreprises have silently been letting people go. They cannot operate at an optimum level because they have neither the working capital nor demand for their products,” said Suresh Agarwal, president of Federation of Rajasthan Trade and Industry (FORTI).

Agarwal said credit to MSMEs has dried up because their loans have been classified as NPAs. “We want the finance minister to redefine NPAs for MSMEs and increase the repayment limit from current 90 days to 1 year as a temporary relief. This will hugely benefit MSMEs. If the government can waive off farm loans, delaying the repayments to banks by the MSMEs should not be such a big issue and what it will do is huge, saving thousands of jobs,” added Agarwal.

Given the fact that the fault lines of the economy are so glaring and diverse, the suggestions were equally passionate and plenty. “There is a need to enhance priority sector lending target for micro enterprises from current 7.5% of adjusted net bank credit to at least 12%. Rajasthan’s industry mostly revolves round MSMEs and they are in urgent need of support,” said Atul Sharma, director, FICCI-Rajasthan.

Shrinking demand has been identified as one of the reasons for economy losing growth momentum. Anand Mishra, chairman, CII-Rajasthan, said that if people have disposable income in their hands, they will be able to spend which in turn will spur demand. “We are hopeful that personal income tax rates should be reduced which will lead to household savings. We suggest that tax litigations must be reduced. Investment in infrastructure sector will lead to government spending and this will bring money in the market leading to boost in economy,” added Anand Mishra.

Similarly, there is also a feeling that real estate industry holds the key to any growth revival. Digvijay Dhabriya, chairman of PHDCCI-Rajasthan said, “Any growth revival hinges on the recovery of real estate industry. The budget needs to give stimulus to the sector. Besides, the auto sector is also critical to the recovery of economy. We hope the finance minister puts money where the mouth is.”

Title: Rajasthan high court order on lottery: SEC to reply on February 3
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: As the Rajasthan High Court gave directions on Thursday that lotteries drawn to reserve seats of the panchayat bodies, ahead of the elections to the remaining ones, ‘should not be given effect without seeking prior permission from it’, the state commission (SEC) will put forward its position before the court on February 3, with panchayati raj department urging it to “present its case strongly before the court and get immunisation in the matter.”

The high court in its order stated, “The plea raised that the said exercise is required for determination of the fact that qua how many panchayats there will be variation in the reservation, is also spacious, in as much as, the said calculation without even drawing the lottery could be made and a decision in this regard could always be taken by the government/election commission.” “However, as the election commission has not responded to the above aspect and the version of the election commission on the entire circumstance is necessary, list the petitions on February 3,” it said.

“In the meanwhile, if any lotteries are drawn by the respondents pursuant to the order dated, January 24, the same shall remain subject to the final outcome of the present writ petition and shall not be given effect without prior permission of the court,” the court said.

Petitioner Vijay Singh had challenged the initiation of lottery schedule in the state. The panchayati raj department had written to the district collectors on January 24 directing them to complete the process of delimitation (wards and other bodies) and to conduct lotteries to reserve seats of sarpanch, ward panch, zila parishad members/pradhans and members of panchayat samitis at the earliest and also asked the districts to send final reports to the state election commission (SEC) and the panchayati raj department before February 5. It also stated that lotteries shall be conducted again in all the panchayat samitis that were affected by notifications issued on December 1 and 12.

The panchayati raj department wrote to the commission (SEC) on January 31 and urged it to “present its case strongly before the court and get immunisation in the matter. An election commission official said, “The commission will put forward its position before the court on February 3 stating that, “It will take a decision on polling (in the remaining panchayat bodies) and other issues related to elections only after receiving information with regard to ward determination and lotteries conducted to reserve seats from the panchayati raj department.”

The SEC also urged the panchayati raj department to send information regarding ward determination and reservation of seats by 5 pm on February 6. “The state election commission will clarify its position on February 3. After that the court may modify its order,” said an official.

Another official said, “When the matter is pending in the Supreme Court, the high court should not have passed this order.”

Title: Puducherry: Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya maintains impressive JEE record
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya (JNV), Puducherry. Image taken from its official website

PUDUCHERRY: Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya (JNV), Puducherry, an autonomous institution under the Union ministry of human resources development maintained its impressive track record in cracking one of the toughest entrance examinations JEE-IIT.

This year, all 31 students from JNV cleared the JEE-IIT main examination and have qualified for the advanced examination.

A jubilant JNV principal P Ramachandran said 25 of the 31 students scored above 90 percentile in the exam. Aprameya Girish Hebbar of Karnataka, who joined the JNV in Class XI stood first in the school in the examination securing 99.83 percentile.

“I take this opportunity to congratulate and appreciate all the students and teaching and non-teaching faculty members on their achievement. The students must now take the JEE-IIT advanced exam in the same spirit and clear it and prove themselves as the best among the best,” said Ramachandran.

Last year too all the students cleared the main exam. All 23 students in 2018, 20 out of 21 in 2017 and all 23 students in 2016 cleared the JEE-IIT main exam.

Ramachandran, students and teaching and non-teaching staff members attributed the achievement to the training extended by Avanti Fellows, a non-government organisation established by former Indian Institute of Technology students Akshay Saxena and Krishna Ramkumar.

Ramachandran said Avanti in collaboration with five or six JNVs, including Puducherry, has been offering two-year online coaching classes for the students. “Everyday, subject experts from Avanti will offer online training from 11.30am to 12.30pm to help them crack the exam. Apart from the online training, mentors from IIT, Madras, will visit the residential school during weekends and motivate the students,” he said.

Each mentor will interact with a batch of four to six students on all Saturdays and Sundays and clarify their doubts besides giving them vital tips for faring well in the exam.

Title: Rihai Manch chief, poet booked again; 7 held at Clock Tower
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Protesters at Clock Tower

LUCKNOW:Barely 20 days after their release on bail, senior lawyer and Rihai Manch president Mohammed Shoaib and poet-activist Deepak Kabir, were booked again on Friday by Thakurganj police for participating in anti-CAA protest.

Thakurganj police lodged an FIR against 14 named persons, including Shoaib and Kabir, and 100 unidentified people for taking out a candlelight march in violation of prohibitory orders on January 30.

Police arrested seven named accused from Clock Tower in Hussainabad early Friday. They were identified as Mohammed Tahir, Jugnu Qureshi, Mohammed Shaan Khan, Rehbar, Dawood, Shavez and Tufail.

All accused were charged with rioting, danger and obstruction to public passage, assault on a public servant to deter him from discharge of duty and entering a prohibited area.

Additional deputy commissioner of police (west zone) Vikas Chandra Tripathi said, “The arrested persons were trying to vitiate the atmosphere where women were protesting peacefully. On January 30, the named persons reached Clock Tower and distributed candles while instigating protestors against CAA and proposed NRC.”

The officer said despite several reminders about prohibitory orders, the protestors continued to stage sit-in.

So far, Lucknow police has registered eight FIRs since the beginning of anti-CAA protests from January 18 in which around 1,000 people have been booked.

Rubbishing claims of the police, Mohammed Shoaib said protestors only paid obeisance to Mahatma Gandhi by lighting a candle.

“Nobody took out a march or held protest. We rather observed silence. Cops are trying to divert the issue and create fear among women protestors by lodging FIR,” he said.

Mohammed Shoaib and Deepak Kabir were arrested in December for their alleged role in violence during anti-CAA protests.

Title: Nirbhaya case: Safeguards, laxity extend wait for justice
Content:
This is for the second time that the execution of the death warrants has been deferred.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme Court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

NEW DELHI: A trial court’s decision on Friday to postpone, “till further orders”, the execution of the Nirbhaya convicts underlines how safeguards introduced by Supreme Court rulings expanding death penalty jurisprudence can be exploited. The dilly dallying by Tihar administration, experts say, is by no means any less responsible for the delay.As far back as 1982, the apex court had acted to prevent “judicial vagaries” in imposing death sentence. In the Harbans Singh vs State of UP case, the court ruled that till the time the convicts exhausted all their legal options, none would be hanged. The court inserted the protection after it emerged in this case that one convict was executed, but a second person was awarded life imprisonment even as the third was set to be hanged.This ruling is reflected in Delhi’s revised jail manual as Rule 854, and was cited by the convicts’ lawyers on Saturday in the trial court, which postponed their execution indefinitely, giving the condemned prisoners a reprieve for the second time in two weeks. Going by the strategic manner in which the four men have exploited loopholes to file mercy, curative and review pleas in close succession, such dilatory tactics may well push the date of execution to March or beyond, since two of the men are yet to file a mercy plea.This is for the second time that the execution of the death warrants has been deferred. The first order, issued on January 7 for January 22, was stayed on January 17. The second warrant, issued on January 17, for February 1, was stayed on Friday.A 2014 ruling by Supreme Court on capital punishment in the Shatrughan Chauhan vs Union of India case also figures as a major factor in deferment of the death warrant. It provides a 14-day window to a condemned person to make “peace with God” and accept his fate, after the rejection of mercy by President. In Mukesh Singh’s case, President Ram Nath Kovind rejected his mercy plea on January 17, well before the scheduled hanging date of January 22. Yet, the Tihar administration expressed its helplessness in carrying out the sentence as that would have breached SC’s mandate.There is, however, merit in the allegations that the jail administration failed to act quickly in July 2018, once Supreme Court dismissed the review plea of three convicts. With the judicial process having got over, experts said that it was when the jail and the trial court concerned could have gone ahead and issued a death warrant. “The process of availing the remedies would have started after July 2018 itself. The prosecution sat for almost two years in carrying out a sentence confirmed by all levels of the judicial hierarchy. There is no rule that says that a death warrant can’t be issued before filing of the mercy plea.
