While extending the safeguard duty and introducing new customs duty could protect Indian industry, it will be a huge setback for the solar sector due to higher price for imported solar and shortage of domestically produced solar panels,” said Garg.

Economic slowdown has provided government with an opportunity to redirect efforts in future proofing its cores. “A $5tr dollar economy, under business as usual, won’t be sustainable; it will have heavy emissions from the core sectors such as cement, steel, infrastructure. If the emissions go unabated, it will sink our economic goals before they are even afloat. Luckily, we have the technology that could reduce emissions,” said Aarti Khosla, director at Climate Trends, adding that these ambitions should be reflected in budget 2020.

Title: South Goa tiatrist acquitted of murdering wife
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: The high court of Bombay at Goa on Friday acquitted tiatrist Anthony Fernandes, who was charged for murdering, dismembering and trying to destroy his wife ’s body in 2016, in Margao.

The prosecution’s case was that on March 24, 2016, at 3pm at Moti Dongor in Margao, Anthony murdered his wife Fiona and in early hours of the next day chopped off her legs, packed her body along with the dismembered legs in a traveller bag. He then took it on a scooter and dumped it at the TB hospital property at Monte in Margao where he set it on fire to destroy evidence.

Anthony was convicted by the sessions court to life imprisonment.

Counsel Arun de Sa representing Anthony argued that the prosecution relied almost entirely on the evidence of the brother of the deceased, who spoke nothing about his presence at the time of the panchanama.

De Sa also argued that the prosecution, realising its predicament, applied after almost 18 months for leave to re-examine him, who then claimed to have been present at the morgue at the time of the inquest panchanama.

The court held that it was constrained to hold that “there is no legal evidence on record” to establish that the dead body was indeed that of Anthony’s wife.

“Curiously, in this case, the prosecution has failed to undertake any blood tests or DNA profiling in order to identify the body. This was easily possible and there is no explanation as to why this was not done. The two witnesses, who are alleged to have identified the dead body, were also not examined by the prosecution without there being any reasonable ground or excuse even placed on record,” the order passed by Justice Mahesh Sonak and Justice M S Jawalkar stated.

The court also found no credible material to connect the knife to the crime.

Title: Registrations under HIRA doubled in one year: West Bengal housing minister
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Housing minister Chandrima Bhattacharya with other dignitaries at Home Front 2020, organised by Credai Bengal ... Read More

KOLKATA: The number of units registered under West Bengal Housing Industry Regulation Act (WBHIRA) has doubled in just over one year. This was disclosed on Friday by state housing minister Chandrima Bhattacharya who was the chief guest at Home Front 2020, organised by Credai Bengal in association with The Times of India . Bhattacharya said that 61,000 projects, including existing inventories and new projects, were registered under HIRA till December 31, 2018. The number of projects has jumped to 1.23 lakh by January 31, 2020.

“This is a major achievement. HIRA is the best property act in the country. It is most transparent and has instilled confidence among home buyers,” she added. Housing secretary O S Meena pointed out that registration under HIRA is no longer restricted to the project in Kolkata only.

Apart from the city, there are registrations from North 24 Parganas, South 24 Parganas, Hooghly , Howrah, Burdwan and Siliguri as well.

Meena said that under HIRA, all the problems have been resolved within the stipulated period of 60 days. There were 225 complaints, out of which 160 have been disposed.

“Most of the complaints are from old projects. The number of complaints for the projects registered under HIRA is less,” he added. Earlier, Bhattacharya had asked all the real estate developers, including the brokers, to register under the act. “Even our Housing Board is registering its projects under HIRA,” she added. Now 815 real estate projects are registered under the act. The president of Credai Bengal, Nandu Belani, said that there have been several landmark legislations over the past three years which have altered the way real estate is transacted.

Title: BSF fire power show from Feb 3
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

All India 50th BSF fire power shooting competition will be held in Jaisalmer from February 3 to February 7, to increase BSF’s capacity of fire power. Over 700 officers and jawans of all the 11 frontiers of the BSF deployed at Bangladesh and Pakistan borders will demonstrate their firing power in the shooting competition to be held at the Kishangarh field firing range near Indo-Pak border in Jaisalmer district. For the closing ceremony on February 7, BSF DG VK Johry is likely to be present.

Title: No new rly projects but hike in funds expected
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Nagpur: When the Union Budget is presented a few hours later on Saturday, there are unlikely to be any detailed announcements for Indian Railways.

Only the ‘pink book’, which gives a financial overview of various works and projects, revealing the detailed allocations for various new and ongoing projects is expected.

The Economic Survey tabled in Parliament on Friday by Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman, who will present the budget, focuses on increasing freight, safety, cleanliness and sanitation. However, railway analysts and experts in the sector expect good funding for ongoing doubling, tripling and quadrupling projects around Vidarbha, a freight traffic heavy region.

“We demand 5-10% rise in funds compared to last allocation and have no idea what is going to come. As it is the railway budget has become a low-key affair after its merger with the general budget,” said railway officials.

Alok Patel, who is closely associated with railway affairs, said, “As part of the National Infrastructure Plan (NIP), the government plans to spend around Rs14 lakh crores till 2024-25. This means investment of around Rs2-3 lakh crore per year in the railway sector. We expect sufficient funds for projects in Vidarbha.”

Patel said a good part of the NIP spending will go towards funding of dedicated freight corridors (DFCs) and network capacity enhancement. A significant part will also be spent on pushing rail connectivity.

“We expect better passenger transport and amenities and strong intercity network. More needs to be done to increase speeds on existing networks as well as development of new terminals in congested cities,” said former Zonal Railway Users Consultative Committee (ZRUCC) member Pravin Dabli.

Patel hopes the budgetary focus will now continue on providing funds for existing projects. New projects are now announced throughout the year, and no longer need any mention in the Union Budget.

Three days ahead of the Budget, the Railway Board has identified six sections for high speed and semi-high-speed corridors. One of these corridors includes Mumbai-Nashik-Nagpur (753km).

Basant Shukla, founder of the Bharatiya Yatri Kendra (BYK), said, “Similar announcements to run trains at maximum speed of over 300 kmph and semi-high speed (160kmph) though are not new, the board should prepare detailed project report (DPR) in a year as promised.”

“Instead of announcing new infrastructure projects, we expect railways to focus on fast-tracking construction of third lines between Nagpur-Bilaspur, Nagpur-Ballarshah and Nagpur-Itarsi to ease congestion,” said Brijbhushan Shukla of Rail Yatri Kendra.

A section of recognized railway union leaders feared the budget would see announcements to fast-track Bibek Debroy Committee recommendations, which suggested corporatisation of the railways in 2015. “The restructuring has already started by merging cadres,” they added.

Title: Teacher didn’t beat, throw Bundi boy in water tank: Probe
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Kota: Police investigation on Friday ruled out punishment by private school teacher to seven-year-old specially challenged boy on Thursday by throwing him into the water tank for not having covering his copies.

Investigating officer at Bundi Sadar police station, where the father of the boy had on Thursday evening submitted complaint regarding severe punishment to his kid, on Friday visited the Central Academy Secondary School in Devpura area of Bundi city and recorded statements of the concerned people. The class teacher, who allegedly punished the boy for not having covered his copies, was actually taking the boy to principal’s room with his complaint when he collided with the school maid who was carrying a bucket of water in her hands that fell over him, the investigation revealed. “The water tank mentioned in the complaint was found locked and circumstances and statements of the concerned people have not verified the allegation of throwing the seven-year-old boy into the water tank and having beaten him severely,” investigating officer Kurshed Khan said. The class mates also did not confirm the allegation of beating the child, he added.

Police said, the boy on Friday was absent from the school and when contacted, his father did not turn up to record his statements. The investigation report in the matter has been submitted to the SP, Bundi, he said and added no case in this connection has been registered.

Title: Odisha: Back from China, youth in hospital over coronavirus scare
Content:
An isolation ward has been set up at SCB Medical College and Hospital, Cuttack, to deal with suspected cases o... Read More

BERHAMPUR: A 25-year-old youth from Phulbani in Kandhamal district, studying in a medical college in China, has voluntarily got himself admitted to the district headquarters hospital after complaining of fever and cold.Mrutunjay Muni, a medical student at Southwest Medical University in the Sichuan province of China, returned home to Phulbani on January 12.A few days ago he complained of fever and cough and cold, initial symptoms of the novel coronavirus (nCoV), which has resulted in more than 200 deaths in China and has forced the World Health Organisation to declare it a global emergency.“After returning from China, I started feeling feverish. I also had cough and cold. Given that coronavirus is spreading in China and the symptoms matched that of the deadly disease, I voluntarily went for a health check-up at the district headquarters hospital in Phulbani,” said Muni, who has been referred to SCB Hospital and Medical College in Cuttack. Muni said he stays in a town close to Wuhan, the epicentre of coronavirus.“The youth has been kept under observation in the isolation ward. Arrangements are being made to shift him to SCB,” said Rajashree Patnaik, chief district medical officer (CDMO), Kandhamal. The hospital in Phulbani has set up a three-bedded isolation ward to deal with coronavirus patients.The CDMO said there was no need to panic as Muni had returned to India much before the outbreak of the virus in China. “The blood samples of the patient will be sent to the National Institute of Virology in Pune for tests,” she added.Santosh Mishra, superintendent of MKCG Medical College and Hospital in Berhampur, urged those who returned from China to report for a health check-up.“We request those who have returned from China to undergo a basic health check-up. They should voluntarily come to hospital,” said Mishra, adding that a 10-bedded isolation ward has been set up at MKCG.Apart from Muni, several youths from Silk City have returned home from China given that this is the time of the Chinese New year celebrations. T Vijya Kumar Patra (25), who works as a junior scientist in a pharmaceutical company at Zibo in China, returned to Berhampur on January 25.“The spread of the disease was not that severe when I returned home. I was screened at the Kolkata airport after landing there,” said Patra, adding that he would return to China only after the disease is brought under control. T Gopi, father of Kumar, said his son did not visit the hospital for a health check-up as he did not show symptoms of the deadly virus.Basudev Paul (31), a research scientist, associated with a company in Shanghai, China, was supposed to return this week and join work on Friday. But he was forced to cancel his flight owing to the spread of the virus. Radhakant Gouda (37), another research scientist, is supposed to return to Beijing on February 15 but has now put his trip on hold.

Title: Telangana: From April 1, brace for higher taxes, more registration fees
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: Come April 1, you may have to pay more towards taxes and registration fees. With revenues dwindling and economic slowdown impacting the state’s growth, the Telangana government is planning to jack up property tax , property registration fee and power tariff .Though the TRS government has been contemplating increasing tax and other measures to mop up revenues, it did not go ahead in view of the municipal elections. Now, with results coming in its favour, the government is likely to go for the jugular. The government often claimed that the growth was badly hit by GST and demonetisation, besides economic slowdown. The state was also undone by lack of financial support from the Centre.Chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao recently made his intentions clear to hike property tax in gram panchayats and municipalities but hastened to add that the poor would be spared. The rich and commercial establishments will have to pay more to make the urban local bodies self-reliant, he said at the presser after TRS’s win in the recent elections.In several municipalities, property tax has not been increased though there is a provision to enhance at least 5% on the existing tax every year. Nearly 70 panchayats have been upgraded to municipalities, but many of them lack basic amenities like roads and drainage facilities.The government has been planning to increase property registrations since a few months. Official sources said the hike could be a minimum of 30% and go up to 50% in some cases on the existing land value for registrations. The present rates were fixed in 2013 and have not been revised since then.A senior registration official told TOI that land rates would be revised in Hyderabad metropolitan region, cities like Warangal and Karimnagar and surrounding districts of Hyderabad where real estate has been flourishing. Chief secretary Somesh Kumar held a meeting with real estate developers and builders and informed the government’s plans to enhance the land value for registrations, the official said. Already, committees have been set up to work out enhancement of land rates.There is also a proposal to hike power tariff for both domestic and industrial consumers. The discoms have not submitted annual revenue requirement (ARR) to the Telangana State Electricity Regulatory Commission (TSERC). The hike is expected to be a minimum of Rs 1 per unit to Rs 5 for industrial users.“The energy department is purchasing power and providing 24x7 supply to all categories of people, including agriculture. There is a huge gap between revenue requirement and earnings. The government may permit us to enhance the tariff,” a chief general manager of Telangana southern discom told TOI.

Title: TN: Farmer, 104, defies age, death; goes under knife, gets back to his fiefdom in five days
Content:
Kittuchami

COIMBATORE: At a time when doctors hesitate to use the scalpel on patients in their 90s and even on those in their 80s, a 104-year-old farmer from Palakkad district in Kerala underwent a major intestine surgery at a Coimbatore hospital. He recovered in 48 hours and got discharged on the fifth day. Now he is back in his farm bossing around.Earlier in January, Kittuchami of Velanthavalam near Palakkad was brought to city-based Liver and Gastro Care Hospital with complaints of severe stomach pain and vomiting. “Our CT scan showed that a third of his intestine was in his scrotum, and that the intestine was obstructed due to a narrow internal hernia ring,” said Dr S Vijaykumar, who performed the surgery. “We had to do a surgery to remove the block.”Kittuchami’s children were initially hesitant and doubted whether he would be able to undergo the surgery at this age. However, since he had no comorbidities such as diabetes, hypertension or asthma and had well-functioning organs, they decided to go in for the surgery. This was the first time Kittuchami has gone under the scalpel. “But I was not scared,” he told TOI.Dr Vijaykumar said, “The 90-minute surgery involved opening up the hernia ring and removing the block. Since old people take longer to recover from anaesthesia, we used more local anaesthesia and less general anaesthesia for Kittuchami. We also used clips instead of sutures because of his wrinkled and fragile skin.”Kittuchami was on liquid diet and began walking 48 hours post-surgery, leading to his discharge on the fifth day. “Now, I can eat normally and get up and inspect my land,” he said.Kittuchami, who had been working on his land till the age of 102, is a teetotaler, non-smoker and does not chew tobacco. “Kittuchami is a clear example that good health can be achieved with a healthy lifestyle, and good health automatically brings about longevity,” Dr Vijaykumar said. Kerala always has the highest life expectancy in the country, at 72.8 years, he added.

Title: Tara Tarini temple facelift likely
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Berhampur: The famous shrine of Tara Tarini in Ganjam district is likely to get a facelift with senior officers led by 5T secretary V K Pandian on Friday visiting the 17th century temple. Apart from reviewing the ongoing projects, he interacted with the members of the temple development committee.

A development package for the famous temple is likely to be declared after the visit of chief minister Naveen Patnaik to the shrine, date of which is yet to be decided. Before filing of his nomination papers from Hinjili constituency, Naveen performed a puja at the temple.

Pandian asked the district administration to expedite all major ongoing projects of the temple before the Chaitra mela starting on March 10. The mela will be held on every Tuesday in the month of Chaitra.

A slope will be constructed near the temple to protect it at an estimated cost of Rs 23.46 crore. To be executed by the rural works department, the slope will be divided into two sections of 130 metres length and 15 metres height and 130 metres length with 18 metres height. It is expected to be completed by May.

“We have given the proposal for a permanent bus stand and beautification work of the temple,” said secretary, Tara Tarini Development Board (TTDB), Pramod Kumar Panda.

Tara Tarini, the twin goddesses are considered the presiding deity of Ganjam. Thousands of people from far off places visit the temple on every Tuesday in the month of Chaitra and on sankrantis.

After reviewing the temple works, Pandian during his day-long visit to Ganjam also visited over 25 government-run high schools in Hinjili block and Hinjili municipality under the chief minister’s constituency. He held discussions with the locals, teachers as well as students for better school infrastructure and also ate the mid-day meal with students at Makarajhol.

At several places, people and students came forward to put forth their grievances for construction of additional school building, toilet complex and demanded filling up of teacher posts.

The 5T secretary was accompanied by Ganjam collector Vijaya Amruta Kulange, project director, district rural development agency(DRDA) Sidharth Sekhar Swain and other officers.

Title: PLEASE DON’T REDUCE FUNDS FLOW TO DISTRICT, INCREASE IT
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Nagpur: Former guardian minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule has urged the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government not to reduce the allocation of the Nagpur district planning committee (DPC).

Recently, deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar had told the media that he would reduce the allocation by Rs299 crore.

Addressing a press conference on Friday, Bawankule said that the BJP-Shiv Sena government had increased the allocation from Rs502 crore in 2015-16 to Rs776 crore in 2019-20. “I urge the government to increase it to Rs850 crore instead of reducing it. I urge the three cabinet ministers of the district — Nitin Raut, Anil Deshmukh and Sunil Kedar — to use their good offices to ensure this,” he added.

The BJP leader said that the party workers would stage a demonstration at the collector’s office on Monday to press for not reducing DPC funds. “I will personally meet chief minister Uddhav Thackeray and Pawar in this regard. I have already written letters to them,” he added.

The former minister said that if the general plan size was reduced, it would impact the special component plan (SCP) as well as the tribal sub plan (TSP) thus affecting the welfare projects for SCs and STs. “Overall, all the works in the district will be affected — rural roads, water conservation, drinking water supply, special grants to gram panchayats, etc”

Pawar had claimed that Nagpur had been given additional funds by reducing the allocation of some districts in western Maharashtra and Marathwada. Bawankule strongly denied this. “It is not possible to reduce the allocation of any district. Nagpur was given special funds as it is the second capital of the state. Injustice was not done to any district,” he said.

Pawar has increased the allocation for Pune, Satara, Sangli and Bid districts. Bawankule said that he has nothing to say on this and only Nagpur’s share should be increased instead of reducing it.

Title: Family of deceased, police file FIR against each other
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Jaipur/Alwar: The family of the teenager who was killed during an exchange of fire between the policemen and the suspected bajri mafia in Dholpur a day earlier has registered a case against the local police. Senior police officials have initiated investigation into the matter. Police also lodged a counter FIR against those who fired at the cops including the family of the deceased.

The deceased boy’s post-mortem was done late night on Thursday and the body was handed over to the family. Initially the family had refused to allow the autopsy demanding action against cops but finally relented and it was done following which the body given to the family around 2 am on Friday. The incident happened in Badi Sadar police station area in Paguli village forest area when cops fired at the alleged ‘bajri’ mafia who had pelted stones and fired at them. When the cops returned fire, a bullet hit Rohit Jaduan. During the exchange of fire, constable Vivek Kumar was also injured.

Govind Gupta, ADGP, Vigilance also reached Dholpur on Friday and after meeting the officials said, “Encounters between police and bajri mafia are happening often and we are mulling over measures to curb them. We will investigate the recent incident also and depending on the facts that come to light, action will be taken.”

Dholpur is notorious for such incidents and just a week back suspected bajri mafia attacked official of Sepau police station in Dholpur district on when he went to inspect stock of illegal gravel and sand.

ASI Rajesh Singh was attacked with sticks and suffered injuries on his hand, legs and head. Local villagers rescued him and he was taken to the hospital where he was administered treatment.

Last year, on August 30, the quick response team (QRT) and the local police had intercepted a convoy of tractors transporting illegally mined sand. Though the police party tried to stop them, the criminals reportedly fired at the police. Two persons, involved in the incident, were killed and four others, including two constables, were injured.

Title: PCMC earns Rs 221 crore more from building permission
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation

Pimpri Chinchwad: The building permission department of the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation ( PCMC ) has earned Rs 221.54 crore more as revenue in 2019-20 from April to December as compared to the same period in the previous fiscal.

The property tax department also recovered Rs70.32crore more in 2019-20 till December as compared to the corresponding period in the last fiscal. Vilas Madigeri, chairman, standing committee, gave the information during a recent meeting to review the civic income.

Speaking to TOI, Shirish Poredi, spokesperson, PCMC engineering department, said, “Large number of building permissions has been given by the civic body this year in the newly-developing areas of Wakad, Ravet, Puanwale, Chikhli, Moshi and Charholi. The building permission department’s annual budget target for 2019-20 was Rs550crore, which has now been revised to Rs700crore.”

The building permission department had earned Rs521.11 revenue in 2019-20 till December, while it garnered Rs299.57crore during the same period in 2018-19. Smita Zagade, assistant commissioner and chief of civic property tax department said, “The department has identified 22,500 new properties this year and conducted their tax assessment, so now they will have to pay property tax. We recovered property tax arrears of Rs35 crore through two Lok Adalats. This has increased the department’s income.”

Suhas Merchant, president of Credai--Pune Metro, said more project approvals have been given in the PCMC areas. He credited better infrastructure and less water issues in PCMC as reasons why more developers are focussing on the region for carrying out development work. Also, he added that approvals come faster from PCMC as compared to PMC.

Title: Redress grievances through Twitter, techies urge GHMC
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Residents of the city’s IT corridoor have urged senior officials of municipal corporations and municipalities to become tech-savvy and launch an effective grievance redressal system through Twitter .

Most of the techies in the city live in and around Manikonda, Nizampet and Adibatla and they urge the civic bodies to make contact numbers and Twitter accounts of senior officials available on their websites.

“I live in Gachibowli and my previous office was in the same area. I used to often file complaints about water shortage, water-logging and commuties woes through Twitter and officials of Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation ( GHMC ) were active on Twitter and used to send workers to solve the issues immediately. But, it’s not the same anymore,” said Pratik Dalal, an employee of TCS in Adibatla.

A resident of Panchavati Colony in Manikonda said that accountability for grievances reported over phone is less. “For example, phones and websites of officials are flooded with complaints of water-logging during downpour. It becomes easy for officials to not keep their assurances made over phone. But if the complaints are raised on Twitter then there is accountability as we can tag the respective department heads and local ministers,” said Jayanth M.

Meanwhile, commissioner and director of municipal administration T K Sridevi said the department is already addressing grievances registered on Twitter as well as a mobile app and website.

Title: Bodies of woman, daughter recovered
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Kota: Bodies of a 30-year-old woman and her 10-month-old daughter recovered from Kalisindh River in Kota late on Thursday night. Both were missing on the intervening night of Wednesday and Thursday. Bodies are kept in mortuary of MBS Hospital for post-mortem which will be conducted after the arrival of woman’s parents from Chhattisgarh.

According to police, the woman has been identified as Padma and her daughter Anjali. Padma was a native of Vilaspur in Chhattisgarh. She was married to one Kailesh Meena of Kheruna village in Kota two years back.

While a search was on for both of them, the locals spotted bodies in the river and informed police. Later, bodies were fished out, police said.

Title: BDA to hold Park Utsav every Sunday
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Bhubaneswar: The Bhubaneswar Development Authority (BDA) has decided to organize a Park Utsav every Sunday over seven weekends from February 2.

The Park Utsav will be organized in some selected big parks on the lines of Patha Utsav (street fest) that used to held on Janpath. On a given Sunday, the festival will be held in at least two city parks simultaneously from 7am to 9am.

BDA officials said activities such as wall painting in the parks, story-telling sessions, yoga, clay pottery, awareness campaigns on different issues will be the main attractions of the event. “This apart, the Mu Safaiwala teams of the Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) will create awareness on how to keep the city clean. The traffic police will join the event to make people aware of road safety and traffic norms. Volunteers of the Bhubaneswar Urban Knowledge Centre will talk about the benefits of riding a bicycle,” a BDA official said.

The BDA has also decided to deploy a 10-member team in each park during the event to oversee the security arrangements and the park infrastructure. The team members will also ensure that people don’t pluck flowers and cause damage to the lights and sign boards. There will be a huge parking space in and outside the parks to avoid congestion. “The BMC has been asked to clean the park after the event is over,” the official added.

Title: 329 employees of BSNL retire under VRS in Kota div
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Kota: Out of 576 employees of Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) in Kota, Bundi, Baran and Jhalawar offices, 329 retired from services under the Voluntary Retirement Scheme on Friday.

The Centre had announced the scheme in a bid revive India’s once most loved and profit-making company by reducing excess manpower.

Across India, 78,000 out of its 1.50 lakh employees have on Friday retires under the VRS 2019, said a senior official of BSNL.

BSNL customers are likely to face trouble and disturbance with telephone, mobile, internet network for around 15 days as the company will now have to work with less than 50% staff that is set to affect its working particularly in maintenance activities in the field.

As many as 348 employees of a total 576 employees were eligible for retirement under union government’s VRS 2019 in BSNL offices in Kota, Bundi, Baran and Jhalawar districts of the division and of them 329 employees have retired on Friday, general manager, Kota division Govind Prasad Gupta said.

Gupta said, of the 329 employees, 243 retired from Kota and Baran districts, while 86 retired from Bundi and Jhalawar districts offices, he added. The VRS 2019 scheme is one-time revival package for the BSNL employees of over 50 years of age and over 50% BSNL employees in Kota showed inclination to it, Gupta said.

“The company has to work with less than 50% manpower and that is certainly going to affect the functioning, operation, particularly in network maintenance in the field for next 10-15 days but the remaining staff will work hard for extra hours to meet the shortage,” Gupta said.

He said, they have floated and opened the tenders for manpower for maintenance work activities and added that ‘managing the work to go on smoothly is only the way out to for revival of the company in present situation.

Title: Andhra Pradesh chief secretary faces CAT heat for not following order
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Nilam Sawhney

HYDERABAD: The Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT) on Friday directed AP chief secretary Nilam Sawhney to explain by February 7 as to why she failed to implement the orders of the tribunal on paying salary and arrears to IRS officer J Krishna Kishore, currently on deputation with the state.

The bench of tribunal chairman Justice L Narasimha Reddy and administration member BV Sudhakar was hearing a plea by the aggrieved IRS officer, who charged the state with harassing him with suspension and criminal cases.

He was brought in by the state four years ago on deputation to head its economic development board. But the YSRC regime stopped paying him salary ever since it came to power in May 2019. It also transferred him to the state secretariat and then suspended him.

It also ordered CID and ACB probe against him for certain alleged irregularities he committed during his stint with the economic development board. The CAT bench earlier described the situation as part of a sinister design hatched by the state authorities and stayed the December 12 suspension of Krishna Kishore, and also directed the state to clear the salary dues within two weeks.

On Friday, when the bench resumed hearing, Krishna Kishore’s counsel Neeraj Malhotra told the bench that even though it has been five weeks since the court ordered the state to pay salary and arrears, it was not implemented. The bench turned critical and said that it would summon the state’s chief secretary to know the reason for her failure in this regard.

The state brought in senior counsel D Prakash Reddy to argue its case. He sought time to know the facts of the case and argue. The bench passed over the hearing to afternoon. Prakash Reddy informed the court in the afternoon session that the authorities have cleared Krishna Kishore’s arrears. The bench did not appreciate the turn of events and sought an affidavit from the CS explaining the reasons for the failure.

Title: Basant Panchami in Ajmer dargah
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Dargah of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishty on Friday celebrated Basant Panchami with flowers. According to a 800-year-old ritual, flowers are offered at the dargah on the occasion of Basant Panchami. The shahi (royal) qawwals offered qawwalis of famous poet Amir Khusroe and flowers of mustard were offered in the main crypt, wishing for prosperity and happiness in the country. Hundreds of devotees participated in the celebrations at the shrine, including the khadims.

Title: HC files PIL to ensure that lawyers maintain decorum
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Ahmedabad: The Gujarat high court on Friday filed a PIL suo motu on how to make the lawyers maintain court decorum and to make them courteous while addressing the court by holding continuous training programmes for people in black gown every month.

After filing a PIL itself, the bench headed by the Chief Justice Vikram Nath issued notices to the Bar Council of India, the Bar Council of Gujarat and the state government seeking their replies by February 25.

The HC filed the PIL on the basis of an order passed by Justice Bela Trivedi on December 19, 2019 for initiation of continuous education and training programmes for advocates.

Justice Trivedi imposed a fine of Rs 10,000 on an advocate Girish Das for his allegedly unwarranted arguments during a hearing. The HC insisted that the Bar Councils and the government should conduct continuous training programmes for advocates so that “the cause of administration of justice may not suffer because of incompetence of the advocates”.

In its PIL, the HC said that there cannot be a strong judicial system without an independent Bar. Lawyers are supposed to be fearless, but they should maintain dignity of judiciary at the same time, and the judges should reciprocate.

There is no room for arrogance either for a lawyer or for a judge.

However, lawyers should not waste court’s time. In case an advocate causes disrepute to judges or involves himself in misconduct, then he/she would destroy the legal system.

Hence, such persons should be removed from the profession.

“An advocate/lawyer is supposed to be governed by professional ethics, professional etiquette and professional ethos which are a habitual mode of conduct. He/she has to perform himself with elegance, dignity, and decency,” the HC’s PIL said and added, “Therefore it is necessary to direct the authorities to carry out continuous education and training programmes because the administration of justice should not suffer because of few advocates”.

Title: 21 returning from China screened for nCoV
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Ahmedabad: Twenty-one people who returned from China were screened at various airports in Gujarat on Friday for signs and symptoms of novel coronavirus (nCoV). Over the past three days, the total number of screened passengers has reached 64, said state health department officials.

Out of the total, eight were from Mehsana, two each from Vadodara, Jamnagar, Rajkot and Surat and one each from Gandhinagar, Dahod, Panchmahal, Surat and Bhavnagar. Health department officials said that there has been no confirmed case of the viral infection as on Friday evening.

“A detailed briefing-cum-workshop was organized for various community health centres and public health centres through teleconferencing on Friday,” said a medical officer with the state health department. “We have covered all major government and GMERS hospitals this week with preparations for isolation wards and the stocking up of medicines.”

The department officials said that while the screening has been strengthened at the airports after India’s first confirmed nCoV case in Kerala, they have appealed to passengers returning from China to get screened voluntarily. “We are keeping a close watch on the national and international developments and following the guidelines issued by Centre,” said an official.

Title: Telangana: Mobile toilets for women cops inaugurated
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Seventeen mobile restrooms and toilets for women officers on bandobust duties were inaugurated by home minister Mohammed Mahmood Ali and DGP M Mahender Reddy in Saifabad on Friday.

The vehicles have been distributed to various district headquarters for use during the Medaram Jatara and eight more will be added in the future, said a police officer. The state police procured the vehicles through e-tender.

“The vehicles have state-of-the-art amenities including one Indian toilet , two western toilets, one washroom, a changing room and two wash basins fitted with a water tank. These units have efficient high-pressure self-cleaning system and can be used by 100 individuals per fill,” Reddy said.

The floor has been designed in such a way to prevent water stagnation.

Title: EPFO cracks down on defaulters
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Panaji: The Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation’s ( EPFO ) regional office in Goa levied a penalty of Rs 10.8 crore on establishments that violated norms, said the regional provident fund commissioner Ashwini Kumar Gupta on Friday.

From April till December 2019, the regional office recovered Rs 5.91 crore, while an amount of Rs 45.9 lakh was recovered as dues in January.

The bank account of Power Engineering India Pvt Ltd was attached and an amount of Rs 8 lakh was recovered.

“The regional office will continue its coercive actions against the establishments for recovery of arrears applications under provisions of CrPc. Cases are being filed against establishments identified as habitual offenders of the EPF provisions,” Gupta said.

A complaint has been filed with the police under provisions of IPC against Joel Engineering for non-remittance of dues deducted from the wages of the employees.

The EPFO has also come out with a service to allow any citizen, employed or unemployed, to obtain the unique Universal Account Number (UAN) using Aadhaar card and mobile number. “This facility is aimed to curtail the hardships and timelag in making remittances of any new employee joining at an establishment, covered under the Act. The new employee may simply provide the generated UAN to his/her employer for making remittances in his PF account,” the EPFO said.

Title: Water supply to be disrupted in Thiruvananthapuram from today
Content:
This story is from February 1, 2020

Representative image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Kerala Water Authority ( KWA ) will complete the renovation works of 86mld treatment plant by connecting standby pumps at the plant. The shutdown for the work will begin at 2pm on Saturday. Though the pumping will resume by Sunday afternoon, water supply will be normal in several areas in the city by Monday night.

KWA has made alternate arrangements to ensure supply in severely hit areas.

According to KWA officials, the final works of renovation of the 86mld treatment plant will be held on Saturday and Sunday. “During the third shutdown, two old pumps of 335HP capacity were replaced with 631HP pump of higher efficiency for the raw water plant. Similarly, two old pumps of clear water plant were replaced with a higher efficiency pump of power 770HP. Now, the work will be held to connect standby pumps at these plants. Already pumps are erected. Installation will be completed during the shutdown,” the officials said.

Important institutions such as hospitals will be provided water in tankers.

Residents living in the following areas may contact the respective numbers for further details.

In Peroorkada, Nalanchira, Mannanthala, Ambalamukku, Vazhayila, Kudappanakunnu residents can contact 9400002030, 8547638186

In Kazhakootam, Karyavattom, Technopark, Manvila, Kulathoor, Pallippuram, CRPF residents can contact 8547638187, 8547638176
